programme.desc: When a drug-laden plane crashes outside of D.C.

programme.desc: When Sue and the team search for the source of a new designer drug, they cross paths with a win-at-all-costs Bounty Hunter (guest star Ron Lea from 'Doc') - who has a score to settle with Jack.

programme.title: My Uncle Is the Green River Killer
programme.desc: After living with the stigma of being related to a serial killer, family members confront Gary Ridgeway in an effort to heal their emotional wounds and bring closure to the families of his victims.

programme.title: The Hunt for the Zodiac Killer
programme.desc: Investigators gain unprecedented access to files, unearthing a complicated cypher that may contain the killer's name as well as links between the Zodiac Killer and an unsolved case; a prime suspect with code training emerges.

programme.title: The Hunt for the Zodiac Killer
programme.desc: The team uncovers clues that the killer may have served in the U.S. Armed Forces, as the supercomputer identifies symbols in the code that would have been known to only a few when it was written; Sal and Ken find new evidence.

programme.title: The Hunt for the Zodiac Killer
programme.desc: The team uncovers a mysterious new cipher related to the Zodiac Killer, while the supercomputer uncovers a strange lunar pattern linking the killings; a taunting riddle by the killer may lead to a body; a second prime suspect emerges.

programme.title: The Hunt for the Zodiac Killer
programme.desc: The hunt goes into high gear as the FBI releases secret files on the killer; a handwriting analyst connects the Zodiac's letters to a taunting letter mailed 3,000 miles away in Albany, N.Y.; the code team has a massive breakthrough on the Z-340.

programme.title: The Hunt for the Zodiac Killer
programme.desc: Sal and Ken investigate San Francisco, the epicenter of the Zodiac Killer murders; the Code Team announces a team member has solved the Zodiac's infamous Z340 code, which has eluded codebreakers for 50 years.

programme.desc: Millions of people around the world claim to have had an encounter with a creature unlike any recognized by mainstream science.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: UFOs sightings are more common among police offices than you might believe and many have witnessed things they can't explain.

programme.title: UFO Hunters

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: In 1956, an object was detected over the North Sea heading toward Bentwaters RAF base--a base with nuclear weapons. Two Venom fighters made contact with the object, but their weapons and electrical systems were rendered useless.

programme.title: UFO Hunters

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: When a woman is brutally murdered on New Years Day 1985, a little boy is left motherless. A family must wait 35 years for advancements in forensic science to catch a killer.

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: In July 1997, the brutal murder of 19-year-old Tiffany Johnston rocks the small town of Bethany, Oklahoma. DNA points to her killer over a decade later.

programme.title: Cold Case Files Classic
programme.desc: Police in Albany, N.Y., get a surprise when a killer they think targets only older women is suspected in the murder of an elderly man.

programme.title: Cold Case Files Classic
programme.desc: On a summer night in 1987 a mother worries and waits for her 19-year-old daughter to come home. But Diana never comes home and she's found raped and strangled.

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: When a 30-year-old mother fails to report for duty in Virginia, the Army lists her as AWOL. Her family immediately suspects foul play and embark on a 13-year quest for answers.

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: In a city of eight million, landlord Bruce Blackwood disappears without a trace in March 2006. Though there is no body, the NYPD is sure this is a homicide.

programme.desc: 13 days after Pam Pitts disappears in 1988 her body is found at a hangout spot in the Arizona desert. Then a second victim is discovered.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: Weaving together the stories of five of America's most notorious serial killers - Ted Bundy, John Wayne Gacy, Jeffrey Dahmer, the Green River Killer and BTK.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: In the mid-to-late 1970s, Bundy, Gacy and BTK begin claiming victims, while Dahmer and the Green River Killer inch ever closer to realizing their grim fantasies.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: With their confidence growing in 1978, Bundy, Gacy, Dahmer, the Green River Killer, and BTK continue their game of cat and mouse with law enforcement; Gacy and Bundy are finally brought to justice; Dahmer struggles to resist his murderous urges.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: After years of evading capture, Gacy and Bundy are finally brought to justice as they both face punishment for their heinous crimes.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: Two of The Five, Gacy and Bundy, sit on death row in the mid-1980s as their murderous rampages are curtailed.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: After years of public fear at the hands of "The Five," the remaining three killers are captured between 1991-2005.

programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: Sixteen-year-old Aaron Campbell didn't admit his horrific crimes until after his conviction; in the dead of night, he abducted six-year-old neighbor Alesha MacPhail and carried her to a nearby wood, where he raped and murdered her.

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.title: Secret Life of Diddy: A Special Edition of 20/20
programme.desc: A look at the shocking arrest of Sean "Diddy" Combs, and the downfall of the famous and powerful hip-hop mogul; new reporting and new details of his alleged criminal enterprise, involving drugs and sex trafficking, continue to come to light.

programme.title: ABC World News Tonight With David Muir
programme.desc: David Muir, former anchor of "ABC World News" weekend edition, tackles the responsibility of helming the weekday report of breaking news, taking the chair previously held by other well-known journalists: John Daly, Frank Reynolds, Howard K. Smith, Harry Reasoner, Barbara Walters, Peter Jennings, Charles Gibson, Bob Woodruff, Elizabeth Vargas and -- most recently -- Diane Sawyer.

programme.title: ABC World News Tonight With David Muir
programme.desc: David Muir, former anchor of "ABC World News" weekend edition, tackles the responsibility of helming the weekday report of breaking news, taking the chair previously held by other well-known journalists: John Daly, Frank Reynolds, Howard K. Smith, Harry Reasoner, Barbara Walters, Peter Jennings, Charles Gibson, Bob Woodruff, Elizabeth Vargas and -- most recently -- Diane Sawyer.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.title: This Week With George Stephanopoulos
programme.desc: Former Clinton White House staffer and current co-anchor of ABC's weekday morning news show "Good Morning America," George Stephanopoulos and co-anchors Martha Raddatz and Jonathan Karl offer a look at current events with a focus on the politics of the day. Each week's show includes interviews with top newsmakers (including some of the nation's top political leaders) as well as a roundtable discussion, usually featuring journalists from ABC and other news organizations, of the week's happenings. Since 2008, the program has broadcast from a studio at the Newseum in Washington, D.C.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: The team tries to outdo themselves with a redesign of 1950 Ford F5 COE.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: The client asks for a last-minute engine swap on the '50 Ford F5 COE build.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Bill and the team fix another shop's botched lift on a 2017 Ford F-350.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A '65 Ford Falcon Club Wagon is transformed into a custom family cruiser.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A 1973 El Camino is transformed into the Ride of the Future.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: After a long pause, the team gets their chance to finish a 1968 Chevy C10.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1937 International Harvester gets a big old Cummins 12-valve diesel engine that's as heavy as the truck itself; a 2005 Chevy Colorado gets a new lease on life as a nitrous-infused drag truck.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1996 dump truck is the largest truck the shop has ever customized; the guys go extra heavy duty to create a military-styled megatruck; a lowrider enthusiast wants a custom air ride and LS swap for his pristine 1934 Buick.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: This year's over-the-top build has Bill and crew lifting a 2020 Chevy Silverado 5500 more than a foot with a custom heavy-duty air suspension; the guys also prove their Texas mettle by radically overhauling the utility bed.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: HOF running back Earl Campbell arrives with the parts of a 1949 Cadillac,

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: NFL Hall-of-Famer Earl Campbell made a career mowing down defenders, so the guys take the same hell-bent approach to rebuilding his 1949 Cadillac; they also customize a van for a disabled motocross rider so he can drive again.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The team revamps an old school '34 Buick into a modern day lowrider; after months of rebuilding the body and making a custom frame for Earl Campbell's '49 Cadillac, the Hall of Famer challenges the shop with a last-minute wrinkle.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A long-time client wants to improve upon a near-perfect '68 Ford Ranger; the team is up to the task with an all-new custom chassis, handmade interior, rebuilt bed and Coyote 5.0 engine swap; the guys check off new custom upgrades on a '75 Bronco.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1996 Impala throws the guys for a loop when they discover it's an imposter; the team makes it better than ever, with custom body fabrications, rear subframe and handmade interior.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Truck builds tend to get bigger than originally planned, so it's no surprise when a 1971 Suburban goes even bigger with a custom lifted air suspension and interior; a nearly finished 2006 Kodiak needs just one more custom upgrade.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and his team make one of their longest custom chassis ever for a new 2020 Denali, and Ekstensive gets a diesel pro-mod drag car back on the track.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive turns a stock 2020 Denali dually into a frame-dropping, show-stopping work truck; as a final touch, Bill handmakes articulating speakers for the bed; Bill takes a family's minds off their brush with a custom 2019 Polaris Ranger.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys bring a 1964 Lincoln back with a late-model Coyote engine and handmade interior; the Sling-Ray is a custom automotive sensation, but Ekstensive has what it's been missing.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1971 Suburban returns to the shop for "phase two," wanting more power and custom metalwork; when a client finds parts and pieces of a '68 C10, Bill and the crew set on a new course for a ground-up build.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill gets dj vu on a 1985 Chevy C10 square body; a handmade chassis; after a close call, Ekstensive makes a 1923 T-Bucket street safe.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A local client wants the teams help to surprise his dad with a custom 1946 Ford Coupe; Bill goes for a mix of both classy and supercharged when working on his wife's 2021 Escalade.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive needs a new shop truck, Bill and the guys go sky-high with a lifted '21 F-450 King Ranch capable of hauling over 20,000 pounds; with most of the '46 Ford Coupe body beyond repair, the team has no choice but to build from the ground up.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys hit the home stretch on the '46 Ford Blue Thunder, its once-rusted shell now rebuilt into a one-of-one showstopper; Bill is surprised when John Cena drops off a '69 MGC.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Builds include a 1979 Little Red Express and a Suzuki Samurai lake crosser.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Builds include a Samurai rock crawler and a Gladiator with a Hellcat.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Mod Mafia transforms a fire-damaged M1038 Humvee ambulance into an extreme camping overlander; the Wide Open Garage team builds a bulletproof race car for the appropriately billed Death Car Race, in which drivers are blindfolded.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A request about a 1947 Ford truck becomes 1 Way Diesel Performance's next ground-up build; Mod Mafia jumps into uncharted territory with a Viper ACRX race car.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Looking into what happens if a Cummins diesel engine is put into a 2004 Lamborghini Gallardo; a customer wants Wide Open Garage to turn an old, rusted Chevy truck into a lifted, all-terrain truck on huge 74-inch tires.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Putting a twin-turbo Cummins into a 2004 Lamborghini Gallardo is a monster build unlike any other for 1 Way Diesel Performance. YouTube's "Unspeakable" star Nathan Graham asks Mod Mafia to help him out of a jam with his all-terrain, amphibious SHERP.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: The 1991 Land Rover Defender is known for ruggedness and simplicity; Mod Mafia does a reboot of a tired, old Defender with modern performance, power and custom luxury; Wide Open Garage takes an old-school Bronco monster truck into overdrive.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Social media star Liver King not only wants Mod Mafia to beef up his prized 2001 H1 Hummer's performance, he wants to customize it for his primal lifestyle; the team at Wide Open Garage must build a custom off-road truck completely from scratch.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Wide Open Garage's mega-truck build gets even bigger as they take an old-school '82 C10 square body and create a one-of-one show truck, monster truck; one Way Diesel Performance lives up to their name by giving an '88 Silverado more than 1,200 horsepower.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: 1 Way Diesel Performance is thrown a mega-curveball with a classic '48 Dodge Power Wagon. In a race pitting garage vs. garage, a 2,700hp diesel truck hits the line against a turbocharged first-generation Camaro.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: Erik Estrada wants to transform his wood-paneled 83 Rolls-Royce limo.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: Team Unique takes on a major project for Nick Cannon's 1967 Chevelle.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: Geraldo Rivera brings his 2004 Tacoma to Team Unique.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: The team flips a Range Rover makeover for rapper Fat Joe.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: Team Unique transforms Mike Epps' Camaro into a custom dream ride.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: In the snowy landscape of Michigan's Northern Peninsula, Derek finds a 1964 Ford Galaxie that's sat abandoned for 32 years; he plans to not only get this Ford running, but also to turn it into a rally-tribute car.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Russell Wilson shook off his first INT in 11 months and hit trade-deadline pickup Mike Williams for a 32-yard touchdown with less than 2:30 left in the fourth quarter for the QB's third scoring throw Sunday, lifting the Pittsburgh Steelers to a 28-27 comeback victory over Jayden Daniels and the Washington Commanders.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Lamar Jackson had 3 fourth-quarter TD passes, and the Ravens stopped the Bengals on a 2-point conversion with 38 seconds remaining to hold them 35-34 on Thursday night. The Ravens rallied from a 21-7 third-quarter deficit.

programme.title: Episode 7
programme.desc: Who is the real Loose Cannon? Lily Newhouse is the amateur who qualified to play in this high stakes cash game. But its Las Vegas businessman Dave Krosky whos confusing pros like Sam Grafton with his unpredictable playing style.

programme.title: Episode 8
programme.desc: More high stakes action from Las Vegas. Loose Cannon Lily Newhouse switches up her style, while local entrepreneur Dave Krosky sticks to his maverick methods. But have the pros finally started to figure him out?

programme.title: Episode 9
programme.desc: The penultimate session of this high stakes cash games sees Las Vegas businessman Dave Krosky test the patience of his opponents. Meanwhile, pro players Maria Ho and Sam Grafton clash in a huge pot.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The town of North Fork becomes a haven for outlaws when suave Ben Judson smooth-talks his way into the marshal's job.

programme.title: Colorado Territory
programme.desc: Outlaw Wes McQueen (Joel McCrea) escapes from jail and travels to a meeting with his old partner-in-crime Dave Rickard (Basil Ruysdael). En route, McQueen dispatches a gang of bandits who try to rob the stagecoach and, in the process, wins the attentions of a young woman (Dorothy Malone) with whom he'd like to settle down. Convinced by Rickard to do one last heist, he finds out that his fellow henchmen are not to be trusted and the woman he truly loves is an ex-saloon girl (Virginia Mayo).

programme.desc: Foreman Gene Autry leads a manhunt for the killer of his boss, owner of the Rocking R Ranch. Gene sends for the owner's niece and heir, but outlaw killers have some plans of their own for the ranch.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Champion helps Gene track down some outlaws when the "Wonder Horse" is entered in what turns out to be a fixed race.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene discovers a poisoned waterhole while on a hunting trip. Attempting to find the culprit, he runs into trouble with an Indian tribe and a railroad camp.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene helps a Mexican boy kidnapped by a gang of outlaws who believe he knows the way to a legendary gold mine.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene tangles with the mysterious Black Rider, who is terrorizing the entire town. The desperate outlaw plans revenge on everyone connected with the execution of a killer.

programme.title: Catlow
programme.desc: A friendly marshal (Richard Crenna) and a hired gun (Leonard Nimoy) hunt a post-Civil War drifter (Yul Brynner) out to rob $2 million in federal gold.

programme.title: Colorado Territory
programme.desc: Outlaw Wes McQueen (Joel McCrea) escapes from jail and travels to a meeting with his old partner-in-crime Dave Rickard (Basil Ruysdael). En route, McQueen dispatches a gang of bandits who try to rob the stagecoach and, in the process, wins the attentions of a young woman (Dorothy Malone) with whom he'd like to settle down. programme.title: Man From God's Country
programme.desc: A former sheriff (George Montgomery) drifts to another town and helps a Civil War buddy clean it up.

programme.title: Roughshod
programme.desc: Rancher Clay (Robert Sterling) and his brother, Steve (Claude Jarman Jr.), head out across the Sonora mountain pass, followed by Lednov (John Ireland), an ex-con seeking revenge on Clay for putting him behind bars. Clay and Steve unexpectedly cross paths with a group of dance hall girls -- including Mary (Gloria Grahame), Marcia (Martha Hyer) and Helen (Myrna Dell) -- whose stagecoach has broken down, and help them get to the nearest ranch, where Lednov unfortunately catches up to Clay.

programme.desc: A cowboy (Tim Holt) and his Irish-Mexican sidekick (Richard Martin) join a war over sheep and cattle.

programme.desc: A ranch foreman (George Montgomery) saves a widow (Diane Brewster) from a cattle baron by catching a prize stallion.

programme.desc: Two old friends find themselves on opposite sides during the Civil War in a desperate battle atop an impregnable mountain.

programme.desc: A renowned gunslinger with a storied past, Tom Horn (Steve McQueen) opts for a reclusive life until he starts working for rancher John Coble (Richard Farnsworth). Though Horn begins seeing pretty local teacher Glendolene Kimmel (Linda Evans), he remains restless. Investigating livestock theft, Horn is brutal when dealing with criminals, and while his presence is initially appreciated, eventually the community grows concerned about the enforcer's violent methods.

programme.title: Harry Tracy
programme.desc: Famed outlaw Harry Tracy (Bruce Dern) is known for his daring train robberies, but lately he's concentrating more on matters of the heart. That's why he's traveling to Oregon to reunite with his sweetheart, Catherine Tuttle (Helen Shaver). She's the daughter of a judge, and it's no surprise that, when Tracy gets to Portland, he winds up behind bars. But no jail built can hold the desperado, and, after breaking out, Tracy finds himself on the run from every lawman in the state.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Louise gets into a feud with Becky after accidentally sending a rude message in the family text thread.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene figures out a plan to afford Mark's college tuition; Jackie and Louise try to help Becky meet a guy.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Neville confronts Jackie about loaning Dan money; Darlene attempts to play matchmaker for Mark.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Mark's graduation approaches, he considers his relationship with his father; Louise plans a big graduation ceremony at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
The episode that has gone down in TV history. Tim Gray was the 21 year-old Head Chef at Bonaparte's in Silsden, West Yorkshire. Claiming to specialise in "fine dining", he had ambitions to be a TV chef and dreamed of opening restaurants in London, Paris and New York. Unfortunately, Tim couldn't even cook an omelette and his trademark scallops made Ramsay throw up. A true kitchen nightmare if ever there was one.
With no customers and a fridge full of fancy ingredients, Bonaparte's was losing money fast. Ramsay soon established that what the people of Silsden really want to eat is Beef and Ale Pie and Treacle Tart. Ramsay soon had the restaurant chocker block but what state is it in now?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
Saturday night at The Glass House Restaurant in Ambleside was a disaster. Orders in the kitchen were mixed up, the food wasn't cooked properly and the customers were complaining. Not only was the chef in tears, but the owners were on the brink of bankruptcy.
A few months on, there have been some departures from the Glass House. Who is in charge of the kitchen now? And, more importantly, is Ramsay's Caesar salad still on the menu?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The Walnut Tree Inn was in big trouble - there was no head chef, the customers had dwindled, and the owner had been forced to sell the family home to keep the business afloat. Set in beautiful Welsh countryside, The Walnut Tree Inn was a successful business for 37 years and became a national institution. But when Francesco bought the place 3 years ago he made the mistake of turning the warm and welcoming country inn into a cold and stark London-style restaurant. And when things went wrong he tried to run the kitchen as well as the front of house. With its Michelin star in jeopardy, Ramsay's first job was to recruit a new head chef so the owner could concentrate on customers. But has Francesco managed to follow Ramsay's advice and stop meddling in the kitchen?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
Nick and Richard are self-confessed restaurant virgins. They've both had successful careers in the brewery business so when they bought Moore Place they believed they could make it an instant success. What they hadn't realized was just how difficult it would be to fill the 90-seater oak-paneled restaurant and how hard it would be to find a chef who could cook decent food.
Has Ramsay's fast-track guide to restaurant success helped these brewery whiz-kids transform their failing ex-Berni Inn into a profitable business? And is the building still painted that disgusting shade of purple?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook their mains and, following the previous day's results, tension is high. Both Marianne and Ryan are cooking muntjac in the hope of impressing the veteran judge, while Sabrina is making an ambitious technical take on a family feast.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With one dish left to impress the veteran judge, the chefs cook their desserts. Marianne is looking to raise a smile with her `carry on' themed dessert, complete with surprise presentation. Sabrina hopes to make it through with an elevated take on jelly and ice cream while Ryan goes all out with his very sweet treat `A Spoonful of Sugar'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining central region chefs do battle for a place in the national finals. They must impress the formidable panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton with their four-course menus.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Andrew is attempting to pay tribute to NHS staff with his take on a traditional healing recipe, `Mum's Flu-Fighting Chicken Soup'. Jason's `A Tea From The Heart' is a play on a post-war remedy which harks back to the era when the NHS was formed.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After the starter results, the chefs return to the kitchen hoping for high scores with their fish dishes. Chris once again is using ingredients he has foraged from around his restaurant, while Jason hopes to impress with a spicy scallop dish and Andrew prepares a cod dish with 11 different elements.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs are pulling out all the stops in a bid for big scores with their mains. All three dishes pay tribute to the founder of the NHS Aneurin Bevan, Chris's `Everything But The Squeal' is an ambitious pork sharing platter, while Jason's `For The Rich And The Poor' showcases lamb, and Andrew is hoping to impress with `Aneurin Bevan For Better Steak'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the dessert course and the last opportunity for the chefs to impress. Chris is hoping to triumph with another dish which showcases the foraged ingredients available around his restaurant, while Jason attempts a technical feat in his dessert inspired by a childhood hospital stay and Andrew is inspired by a dish by his great grandmother used to cook. Which two will make it through to the judging chamber?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the Wales regional final as the two remaining chefs do everything they can to impress the judging panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. After tensions ran high in the week, the chefs are under pressure to deliver perfection. The judges are joined by Aneira Thomas, the first baby born on the NHS, who is named in tribute to the service's founder Aneurin Bevan and who went on to dedicate her life to the service. Who will win a place in the national finals?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the turn of three chefs representing the south west, including two who have competed before but meet in the kitchen this week for the very first time. The chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their celebratory starters.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and with Tom renowned as a fish specialist all eyes are on him. He's cooking his take on a classic British fish supper in tribute to a charity which looks after the health of local fishermen. Jude is attempting a complex fusion dish featuring four different fish and an unusual X Ray themed presentation, while Olivia is paying tribute to the staff who looked after her during the birth of her first son with her take on curried monkfish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the main course and two of the chefs are hoping duck will win the day. Tom is preparing a technically challenging duck dish steeped in NHS history while Jude is making a multi-element Chinese duck dish inspired by his mum. Olivia is hoping her dish, using two unusual cuts of beef, will score top points. Olivia also visits her local children's hospital, home of the second busiest paediatric A&E in the country.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With just one more chance to impress their veteran judge, the chefs are all hoping to use their pastry skills to deliver technically complex desserts. Tom's cooking an `Invalid Fruit Tart' inspired by a 1950s recipe, while Jude is making six different apple elements for his `An Apple A Day'. Olivia is using stout in reference to an outdated old wives' tale which suggested the drink was a healthy source of iron during pregnancy.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's time for the two remaining chefs representing the South West to go head to head as they cook their menus again for the exacting panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. With a spot in the National Finals at stake, both are aiming for perfection as they bid for glory. The judges are joined by Barbara Childs, a Matron in the Cardiac Intensive Care Unit at Great Ormond Street Hospital, who isn't afraid to speak her mind in the chamber.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs take to the kitchen in a bid to represent the north west in the national final. They include Ellis Barrie, from the award winning Marram Grass in Anglesey, Liam Simpson-Trotman, an accomplished pastry chef and co-owner of the 4 AA rosette Orwell's in Oxfordshire, and Craig Sherrington, who sharpened his skills working under top names including Eric Chavot and is now Chef Patron of Virginia House in Cumbria.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and the chefs are all gunning for tens. Craig pays tribute to a friend who has revolutionised hospital food in Morecambe Bay, while Liam is inspired by health advice his grandma gave him and Ellis is dedicating his dish to the staff who delivered his son Albert. With cod, mackerel, shrimp and cockles on the menu, which of the chefs will score highly?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Time for the chefs to cook their mains and the pressure is on. Craig is hoping to impress using two cuts of Dexter beef, while Liam prepares his take on a Bajan lamb stew and Ellis prepares four cuts of suckling pig. Liam meets his personal hero, Nola Ishmael OBE, who became the UK's first ever black Director of Nursing.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the last chance for the North West chefs to impress in a bid to make it through to the regional final. Liam is cooking `Not So Hot Toddy' in honour of a friend who works nightshifts in the NHS, while Ellis' `Worth Their Weight in Gold' is dedicated to the staff who saved his brother's life and Craig's dish `The Missed Celebration' pays tribute to his wife with an unusual Christmas concept.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from the week return to cook their menus again. Judging them are Matthew Fort, Oliver Peyton and Andi Oliver who are joined by Dr Jake Dunning MBE, an infectious disease specialist who has been recognised for his work during the West Africa Ebola epidemic.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs are doing battle to represent Northern Ireland. Tommy Heaney, Head Chef at the Great House Hotel in South Wales is taken on by Shauna Froydenlund, Chef Patron at Marcus Wareing's two Michelin starred restaurant and James Devine, the 2017 National Chef of the Year.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After a tense starter course, the chefs return to the kitchen to cook their fish dishes. James is making his elevated take on a fried chicken takeaway as a tribute to the NHS staff who care for his sister. Shauna is also taking inspiration from a personal connection with a tribute to staff from a facility in her hometown of Londonderry. Tommy is hoping to impress with a dish dedicated to the discovery of DNA.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With two courses down it's time for the chefs to cook their main courses. It's the battle of beef with each using the same meat in their innovative creations. Tommy also meets the first baby ever born on the NHS.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the final chance for the chefs to impress. After such a tightly fought battle all week, each is hoping to deliver a technically perfect dessert. Tommy and James are both using passion fruit in their complex dishes while Shauna is hoping to use her pastry chef training to score full marks.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs representing Northern Ireland go head to head. Judging as ever are Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver who are joined by Shehan Hettiaratchy, lead trauma surgeon at St Mary's Hospital who helped treat victims of the Grenfell Tower fire.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The winning chefs from all eight regions must battle it out for the honour of a spot on 2018's `Feast To Say Thank You' banquet menu, celebrating 70 years of the NHS, one of Britain's most prized institutions.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs must cook their fish courses but after some exceptionally high-scoring dishes in the starter round, everyone is desperate to deliver perfection. Once again the chefs present their innovative, witty or heart-warming creations.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's main course day and with only two spots remaining on the banquet menu, the competition is fierce. Both chefs and judges alike are amazed at the high standard of cooking and an incredible number of 10s are dished out as the chefs serve up venison, rabbit, duck, beef, lamb and pork for scrutiny.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's dessert day and with just one place remaining at the banquet feast, each chef is giving everything they've got for a chance to say thank you to the heroic NHS staff. All the chefs have significantly re-worked or re-invented their desserts since the regional heats, proving that they'll do everything they can in a bid for that final winning spot.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the grand finale as the winning chefs cook their dishes at a banquet for the heroes of the NHS. Having arrived at St Bartholomew's Hospital, the chefs are shown the incredible location for event, the almost three-hundred-year-old Great Hall.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Andrew Pern, Stephanie Moon and Tim Bilton prepare their starters which include potted venison with watercress and crisp fennel salad, `salmagundi' of North County produce, and sticky pigeon breast, forager's relish, hedgerow and beetroot crisps.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Andrew Pern, Stephanie Moon and Tim Bilton prepare their fish dishes: seafood stew, fish soup with a toasted kipper club sandwich and hot oak smoked Kilnsey trout, golden tea cream and Daleside scraps.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Andrew Pern, Stephanie Moon, and Tim Bilton make haymaker's twice-baked Nidderdale lamb, bluemin white potatoes and gravy, suckling pig with pork pies, black pudding, Scotch eggs and sticky spare ribs, and whole roast stuffed suckling pig.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the North East to impress. Tim Bilton, Andrew Pern and Stephanie Moon deliver their desserts which include gooseberry and apple crumble, a celebration of rhubarb and custard and Yorkshire mess.

programme.desc: Only two chefs remain, as they cook their entire menus for judges Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don uncovers the extraordinary stories behind Britains seventeenth century gardens.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don arrives in the eighteenth century, an age that gave rise to the landscape garden.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty visits influential gardens of the 19th Century, from royal retreats to the very first public parks.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty concludes his journey by looking at how the nations gardens have evolved over the last hundred years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As Monty brings in the summer harvest, he gives advice on what to sow to keep the crops coming up to the end of Autumn. Carol Klein visits a woman who is losing her eyesight and gives her recommendations of plants that will be a feast for her senses.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.desc: When the weather in San Diego throws the crew a curveball, Ali, Rush and friend Brandon Nelson put together plan B. programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Fishing with friend Tony Murphy in Key West, the guys head into the Gulf of Mexico to target jumbo sized Bonito behind the shrimp boats. With a brand new boat on the way, Rush hopes to stock up on his prized bait source for the shakedown trip and upcoming charters on the new rig.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush and Ali head to La Paz Mexico to fish with longtime friends and soak up some Baja living in the City of Peace. In part one of this two part series, the guys fish offshore targeting striped marlin and dorado with a few surprises.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The La Paz adventure continues as Rush and Ali get a better understandingof the town (and its taco spots), before heading out for some inshore fishing, targeting roosterfish andsnapper.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush and Ali are back in San Diego, California to fish offshore for Yellowtail and Bluefin Tuna.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With Season 6 in the can, Ali and Rush lookback on some of the places, catches, and memorable moments during this year of new normal.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Kristy goes on her first turkey hunt in Missouri. Thanks to her fathers shotgun and her brother guiding her, Kristy is able to walk away with not only the highest of emotions, and the hunger to continue her new hunting lifestyle, but she was able to provide a meal for her and her husband from field to table.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: After open-heart surgery, Seth wasnt sure if he could hunt again. But with determination and a crossbow, he proves anything is possible, taking down a big Ohio buck. See how heart, grit, and passion lead to an unforgettable harvest. Dont miss Seths inspiring comeback!

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Managing a healthy deer herd is part of being a responsible hunter. Stephen, Candice, and Cliff take on the challenge of herd management by focusing on does. Its not just about the huntits about preserving the future. Join them on this important mission and see how its done.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Cliffs hard work managing a farm with the landowner finally pays off with a big Kentucky whitetail in his sights. This hunt is more than just a trophyits the result of years of dedication. See the hunt that proves patience pays off, and feel the rush of success yourself!

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Nothing beats a hunting trip with friends. The Working Class Hunter team heads to Illinois to share laughs, build bonds, and of course, chase big whitetails. Its more than just huntingits about the memories made along the way. Watch this episode and feel like part of the team!

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Hunting after loss is never easy, but Seth honors his late father by harvesting the last deer he passed on. This emotional hunt in Illinois is about more than a killits about family and legacy. Come along for the journey and see why this moment means everything.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Join renowned outdoor writers Dan Schmidt and Bob Robb on an exhilarating turkey hunting adventure near the iconic Devils Tower in Wyoming.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: A close-knit group of friends from Wisconsin embarks on an exciting duck hunting adventure. As dawn breaks over the tranquil lakes and marshes, the camaraderie and shared passion for the outdoors are palpable among the group.

programme.title: Modern Hunter

programme.title: Modern Hunter

programme.title: Modern Hunter

programme.title: Modern Hunter

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: After her first turkey, Kristy is ready for her next challengea buck on her own land. With her husband by her side, she experiences the thrill of her first antlered deer. Emotions run high, and this hunt is one shell never forget. Experience the joy of her success with her!

Tune in and see what they can make happen on a challenging weather day seeking the elusive Snook!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We return to the Ellie B and head a hundred miles offshore to repeat last years epic tuna bite. But someone must have brought a banana on board because the plan suddenly turned into an unexpected adventure.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan and Bryan Brown hunt down at Honey Brake Lodge in Jonesville, Louisiana. Honey Brake is known for it's duck hunting, but because of WRP management practices, big buck habitat has been created. Did Drew Keith's doe decoy idea really work? Find out now!

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: The guys with Pacific Calls are blown away by the Maxus II. A pure waterfowlers gun.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this special edition of Huckberry Homes, we explore Floki Studios. Floki Studios is a renowned recording studio nestled in the rugged seaside of Iceland, offering artists an unparalleled environment for creativity and collaboration. Situated on the fringes of the Arctic Circle, this sanctuary provides a haven far removed from the bustling distractions of urban life. Surrounded by the untouched beauty of Iceland's pristine nature, Floki Studios is more than just a recording space; it's a haven designed to inspire and enhance the creative journey.Behind the scenes, Floki Studios thrives thanks to a dedicated team, deeply committed to the art of music. Jay Sweet, the Music Ambassador, stands out for his passion and advocacy for artists, embodying the studio's ethos of nurturing creativity. This partnership between Jay and the Floki Studios team exemplifies a unique blend of individual dedication and collective effort, providing artists with a space that fosters creative freedom and collaboration."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this special edition episode of Huckberry Homes, we travel to New York to get a rare look inside The Explorers Club headquarters. For the last 120 years, The Explorers Club has been the exclusive epicenter where legendary explorers come together to share some of the most incredible adventure stories ever told. From Roald Amundsens 1911 voyage to the South Pole to Sir Edmund Hillarys ascent to the summit of Mount Everest to astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrins history-changing 1969 expedition to the moon, the halls of this institution have echoed with tales of daring discovery and unparalleled human achievement. Thats why were beyond stoked to kick off our Huckberry x The Explorers Club partnershipfeaturing the Land, Sea, and Space Collection from an exclusive Whiskey Peaks collab and a badass grand prize. Tune in now to watch a tour so exclusive, its almost like being inducted into the club itself (minus the secret handshake)."

programme.desc: Part of our responsibility as citizens in this country is to make sure we not only take care of these resources but we hand it off to the next generation in better condition that we found it. -Bob Ziehmer, Senior Director of Conservation for Bass Pro Shops & Cabela's Join Bob in New Mexico as he talks about taking care of our natural resources for future generations. programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: It might be cold and windy, but if you have trust in your guide the result could be an epic day of fishing! Rush steps up to the challenge and puts Ali on an incredible bite of mutton snapper while also checking another species off of Ali's bucket list!

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Escape to the beautiful shores of Grand Isle, Louisiana where musician and community advocate David St. Romain joins Chef Jay Ducote for a weekend of fishing, crabbing, and oyster harvesting. programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Cajun classics are met with a Zimbabwean flair in this delicious mashup of cultures. Join Chef Jay Ducote and Food Network Star Rue Lindsay as they take on the fishing village of Cocodrie, Louisiana. Guided by Captain Zach LeBeouf, this tasty adventure will surely leave you hankering for more.

programme.title: Tidewater Diaries
programme.desc: In this episode, Captain C.A. is reminiscing with The Mogan Man, Blair Wiggins. Blair has over 20 years of television experience where hes flipped inshore fishing upside down. Watch along as they relive the formative years and discuss a lifetime of fishing!
Joe Miles Owner of Asio Gear, chases big whitetails in Kentucky, Kansas and Mexico!
Kris and Flint Seymour hunt down a Kansas giant!
After filming his son kill his first 200 monster, Kris Seymour chases big bucks in Kansas, Oklahoma and Canada.

This week we celebrate the 40th Anniversary of Lone Wolf stands and the man that started it all, the Lone Wolf himself Andrae DAcquisto. As we take a look back at Andraes career, how it all started and where its heading after 4 decades, Andrae shares some insights on his hunting strategies and the equipment he has designed that made him one of the top bowhunters in the country!
Adam and Logan Hays chase big bucks in the Buckeye State!
Tarif Alkhatib hunts a couple giant whitetails in his home state of Texas!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Episode one hits close to home. Specifically, Joshs hometown of Seattle where we travel from the mountains to the coast in pursuit of local ingredients for an authentic Washington meal. Digging for forest delicacies, hunting for exotic bivalves, and exploring the tidal flats of a multi-generational shellfish farmits all on the menu.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisianas only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his familys traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, hell meet plenty of farmers and foragersharvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. Thats where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredientsfrom sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintans kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float planea new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, the land of earth, sea, and sky. All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaskas abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. Therell be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for nowjoin usthere are halibut to filet, rainforest shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes.In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledgeand point the way to the future."

P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes.In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledgeand point the way to the future."

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Episode one hits close to home. Specifically, Joshs hometown of Seattle where we travel from the mountains to the coast in pursuit of local ingredients for an authentic Washington meal. Digging for forest delicacies, hunting for exotic bivalves, and exploring the tidal flats of a multi-generational shellfish farmits all on the menu.

programme.title: Bonefish & Tarpon Trust
programme.desc: Watch the video to learn more about bonefish and tarpon connectivity and the importance of conservation at local and regional levels.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: In Part 2, Day 2, Mark Peterson continues his quest to complete the Upland Slam of 27 bird species in a series only available on YouTube, The Journey Within A Bird Hunters Diary. Mark is in Alaska hunting the three species of ptarmigan; willow ptarmigan, white-tailed ptarmigan and rock ptarmigan. This is a two part episode where Mark is hunting with his father Earl as they cover miles of rocky terrain in search of these elusive birds in the high elevations of Alaska.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark is still on the South Island of New Zealand chasing the Wingshooting Slam. Its Mark's last day to complete the waterfowl portion of the slam and he still needs a Black Swan and a Shoveler. This hunt is taking place on a freshwater lake right off the ocean. The temperature is unusually warm for this time of year, but thankfully that hasnt affected the numbers of birds around.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: It's day 2 in Wyoming and Mark Peterson is hunting the opening day of Sage Grouse with his dad, Earl. Join them and their dogs on this high elevation Sage Grouse hunt, covering some of the best grouse habitat in the country.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: The last hunt in this series takes us to Texas in February of 2017. This time Mark is after his first Aoudad with a muzzleloader. Aoudad were introduced to Texas as an exotic species and it didn't take long for them to establish a large viable population in the ideal habitat that West Texas offers. Going into this hunt with the confidence and extended range that only Gunwerks can provide, Mark knows the odds are in his favor and it doesn't take long to come across multiple bands of rams. Thanks for following along in this 3 part series as we looked back on some of Mark's most memorable hunts for these incredible animals found all over the world. Click the link below to join and learn more about The Wild Sheep Foundation.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: In Part 3, Day 3, Mark Peterson wraps up his time in Wyoming upland hunting with an epic partridge hunt. Does he run into some chukars along the way? Take a look inside this episode to find out!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Petersons Journey in Argentina continues with some morning madness. Taking four animals, this is one of the best morning hunts he has had yet. After an already incredible week of hunting, Mark is looking for a few species that caught his attention earlier in the trip and turns up a Hybrid Sheep, Hybrid Mouflon, Feral Goat and a Multi Horn Sheep. Temps are abnormally hot in Argentina for this time of year and the animals will be heading for cover by mid day to stay cool. Mark and his guide Charley make a plan to cover a lot of ground in hopes of catching them out feeding before they disappear.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: In Part 4, Mark Peterson ventures to South Dakota for prairie chickens and sharp-tailed grouse. South Dakota is well known as the pheasant hunting capital of the world, but with its rolling prairie lands, also holds great habitat and numbers of prairie chicken and sharp-tail grouse. Take a look as Mark chases both and find out if he connects.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is known as the Slam guy. He has completed the North America and South America Waterfowl slams, each in a single season. After some thought and due diligence, Mark is now embarking on a journey to complete one of the most diverse slams there is, The New Zealand Wingshooting Slam. Mark starts this journey with his 828 U Benelli, going after turkey and quail.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: Mark and Earl set out to check species number 21, the chukar, off their upland slam list. Typically chukars live at higher elevations making it an earned feat to harvest one. Can Mark and Earl battle steep rocky terrain at over 4000 feet in elevation? Stay tuned for more The Journey Within Episodes every Thursday. We are getting close with Mark only needing to harvest another 6 species!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's early November and Mark Peterson heads north of the border to Saskatchewan to chase down his Northwestern whitetail. Unseasonably cold temps are staring Mark in the face and it has the deer hunkered down for a day and a half, but the power of food prevailed. On day two, with only 8 minutes left of shooting light, Mark's target buck showed up.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: Mark Peterson and his father, Earl, travel down to the great state of Kansas in hops to knock another quail species off their list. The North American Bobwhite Quail hold very tight and fly spastically from their covey. River bottoms and thick grasslands are the habitat of choice of these fast fliers. A river crossing and a broken up covey allow Mark to check the Bobwhite Quail off his list. Only a few species left to complete the Journey Within - A bird Hunters Diary!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is duck hunting for the 4th day in Argentina and finds that luck is on his side. He and Matt head to a blind for an early morning hunt in hopes of getting a Black Headed Duck before they disappear for the day in the reeds. He also still needs a Red Shoveler, but things take a quick turn while he is walking through the marsh, about to call it a day. Enjoy this episode of The Journey Within

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and the new producer (Tim Guidroz) go out on their first turkey hunt together, and even though the weather is not ideal, they get the job done on a Wilkinson County gobbler. We also get a look at what the United Country - Southern States Realty office looks like during turkey season, with interviews from Scott Lindsey and Caleb Armstrong, and three big properties closing in Baton Rouge.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade takes Bentley on his very first duck hunt. Slade also gets to take a trip to duck hunting paradise with some great buddies of his. This episode is all about having a great time with great friends.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes us through his new investment property, and breaks downwhats involved in taking a raw land tract and creating extremely desirable turn-keyhunting properties.Caleb and Slade double up on some Wilkinson County gobblers for Calebs first turkeykill ever.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade gets very busy in the real estate world. But lucky for him, Caleb Armstrong takes up the slack. Caleb sets out to hunt swamp bucks on the public land of Tensas Parish.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode we take you behind the scenes of production for one of the biggest and baddest listings Slade has ever gotten - Southside Land Company in Jefferson County, MS. Hunter Phelps comes down from Kentucky to help film, and Slade puts him on 2 Mississippi gobblers.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade goes over what hes doing at his home property to create summer food plots for deer, and gives tips to those looking to do the same. On the final hunt for the 2024 season, Lori gets a big Wilkinson County gobbler.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade is staying busy busy around the house, lots of testing on summer plots with Deergro and Backwoods bachelor pad blend. Also, there locally he takes a quick look at the new 60 acres he and Ryan bought as an investment property. Then ends with a throwback hunt from under the barn.

programme.title: HUnting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his brother Tai take us around a new investment property - a 55 acre tract in Wilkinson County, MS and go over what it took to take an undesirable raw tract, to a place with multiple offers on the first day it was put on the market.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Watch as Lori tags her first turkey of the season as well as the daily grind and comments from the office in McComb, Mississippi. The ladies in the office isnt too fond of turkey season until its their turn.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Continuation of the podcast between Caleb and Slade on land investing.

programme.title: Local Knowledge

Targeting Yellowtail and Mako sharks, the guys search for kelp paddies on the horizon and look to friend at the fish house for some shark attractant to make it all come together.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Fishing with friend Tony Murphy in Key West, the guys head into the Gulf of Mexico to target jumbo sized Bonito behind the shrimp boats. With a brand new boat on the way, Rush hopes to stock up on his prized bait source for the shakedown trip and upcoming charters on the new rig.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush and Ali head to La Paz Mexico to fish with longtime friends and soak up some Baja living in the City of Peace. In part one of this two part series, the guys fish offshore targeting striped marlin and dorado with a few surprises.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The La Paz adventure continues as Rush and Ali get a better understandingof the town (and its taco spots), before heading out for some inshore fishing, targeting roosterfish andsnapper.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush and Ali are back in San Diego, California to fish offshore for Yellowtail and Bluefin Tuna.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With Season 6 in the can, Ali and Rush lookback on some of the places, catches, and memorable moments during this year of new normal.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Kristy goes on her first turkey hunt in Missouri. Thanks to her fathers shotgun and her brother guiding her, Kristy is able to walk away with not only the highest of emotions, and the hunger to continue her new hunting lifestyle, but she was able to provide a meal for her and her husband from field to table.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: After open-heart surgery, Seth wasnt sure if he could hunt again. But with determination and a crossbow, he proves anything is possible, taking down a big Ohio buck. See how heart, grit, and passion lead to an unforgettable harvest. Dont miss Seths inspiring comeback!

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Managing a healthy deer herd is part of being a responsible hunter. Stephen, Candice, and Cliff take on the challenge of herd management by focusing on does. Its not just about the huntits about preserving the future. Join them on this important mission and see how its done.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Cliffs hard work managing a farm with the landowner finally pays off with a big Kentucky whitetail in his sights. This hunt is more than just a trophyits the result of years of dedication. See the hunt that proves patience pays off, and feel the rush of success yourself!

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Nothing beats a hunting trip with friends. The Working Class Hunter team heads to Illinois to share laughs, build bonds, and of course, chase big whitetails. Its more than just huntingits about the memories made along the way. Watch this episode and feel like part of the team!

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Hunting after loss is never easy, but Seth honors his late father by harvesting the last deer he passed on. This emotional hunt in Illinois is about more than a killits about family and legacy. Come along for the journey and see why this moment means everything.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Join renowned outdoor writers Dan Schmidt and Bob Robb on an exhilarating turkey hunting adventure near the iconic Devils Tower in Wyoming.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: A close-knit group of friends from Wisconsin embarks on an exciting duck hunting adventure. As dawn breaks over the tranquil lakes and marshes, the camaraderie and shared passion for the outdoors are palpable among the group.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Brad Rucks heads to Illinois to test out the new 360 Buckhammer straightwall cartridge.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Brad Rucks gets a chance to punch a long awaited Wisconsin sturgeon tag and then chats with the local DNR to learn about sturgeon spawning season.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Father/son duo Brad and Noah Rucks are after the same giant whitetail that's making regular appearances on their family farm.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Retired army nurse Linda Powel wins a dream hunt in Texas hosted by Record Rack Deer feed. What's the catch? Linda has never hunted a day in her life!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Denise Sanchez was awarded a hunt at G2 following our Hunters Extravaganza drawings. Its great to get to spend time on the ranch with new members of TTHA. Denise gets familiar with a giant and learns about new technology while on this hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: After her first turkey, Kristy is ready for her next challengea buck on her own land. With her husband by her side, she experiences the thrill of her first antlered deer. Emotions run high, and this hunt is one shell never forget. Experience the joy of her success with her!

programme.desc: 14 year old Fly Angler Stevie Kim-Rubell joins Jared in Islamorada.

programme.desc: Live Bait Chumming

programme.desc: Louisianas Cajun Ninja joins Chef Jay Ducote in our latest catch-and-cook adventure. Tag along as they hit up the hottest fishing spots in Plaquemines Parish with Captain Shane York and turn their catches into authentic Cajun meals.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny meets up with Chef Dave in the Golden Ilse to target Reds and Trout. Then head to Halyards to cook the catch.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA takes his Son Cam to the Sports Coast for some friendly Father Son competition.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: On this episode Capt. Danny joins his good buddy and talented marine artist, Stephen Ferrell. The two of them take the 27 DekKat to fish some of Stephens favorite paddle-board spots here in Melbourne, Florida. Tune in and see what they can make happen on a challenging weather day seeking the elusive Snook!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We return to the Ellie B and head a hundred miles offshore to repeat last years epic tuna bite. But someone must have brought a banana on board because the plan suddenly turned into an unexpected adventure.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan and Bryan Brown hunt down at Honey Brake Lodge in Jonesville, Louisiana. Honey Brake is known for it's duck hunting, but because of WRP management practices, big buck habitat has been created. Did Drew Keith's doe decoy idea really work? Find out now!

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: The guys with Pacific Calls are blown away by the Maxus II. A pure waterfowlers gun.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this special edition of Huckberry Homes, we explore Floki Studios. Floki Studios is a renowned recording studio nestled in the rugged seaside of Iceland, offering artists an unparalleled environment for creativity and collaboration. Situated on the fringes of the Arctic Circle, this sanctuary provides a haven far removed from the bustling distractions of urban life. Surrounded by the untouched beauty of Iceland's pristine nature, Floki Studios is more than just a recording space; it's a haven designed to inspire and enhance the creative journey.Behind the scenes, Floki Studios thrives thanks to a dedicated team, deeply committed to the art of music. Jay Sweet, the Music Ambassador, stands out for his passion and advocacy for artists, embodying the studio's ethos of nurturing creativity. This partnership between Jay and the Floki Studios team exemplifies a unique blend of individual dedication and collective effort, providing artists with a space that fosters creative freedom and collaboration."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this special edition episode of Huckberry Homes, we travel to New York to get a rare look inside The Explorers Club headquarters. For the last 120 years, The Explorers Club has been the exclusive epicenter where legendary explorers come together to share some of the most incredible adventure stories ever told. From Roald Amundsens 1911 voyage to the South Pole to Sir Edmund Hillarys ascent to the summit of Mount Everest to astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrins history-changing 1969 expedition to the moon, the halls of this institution have echoed with tales of daring discovery and unparalleled human achievement. Thats why were beyond stoked to kick off our Huckberry x The Explorers Club partnershipfeaturing the Land, Sea, and Space Collection from an exclusive Whiskey Peaks collab and a badass grand prize. Tune in now to watch a tour so exclusive, its almost like being inducted into the club itself (minus the secret handshake)."

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons is looking for dinner with Chef Dave MacLennan from Even Keel Fish Shack as they explore the waters around Ft Lauderdale
