programme.desc: Meredith learns the value of the Trash Can Slam on a flounder trip withCapt. Justin that turns into a multi-species challenge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin Leake and Meredith McCord divert attention from whats not happening with the tarpon bite to using CoastMaster, light tackle and experience to find snapper success on heavily fished public spots.

programme.title: Rack Daddies
programme.desc: We took all of our best deer hunts from the 2019 season and put them into a highlight video, just for you. Season 5 is a wrap!!

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation
programme.desc: Part of our responsibility as citizens in this country is to make sure we not only take care of these resources but we hand it off to the next generation in better condition that we found it. -Bob Ziehmer, Senior Director of Conservation for Bass Pro Shops & Cabela's Join Bob in New Mexico as he talks about taking care of our natural resources for future generations. Special thanks to Express UU Bar Ranch

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Father/son duo Brad and Noah Rucks are after the same giant whitetail that's making regular appearances on their family farm.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to the plantation on Crystal River to fish with Dallas King For trout and redfish.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Headed out of Crystal River once again, Capt. Blair & Capt. Mike Avinon of Circle Hook Fishing Charters head way out deep again for a few different species.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: What do you do when you fish for a living and get a day off? You go fishing! With weather on the forecast and a last minute cancelation, Rush calls long time friend Capt. Tony "Key Limey" Murphy to see what will bite before the cold front hits Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: It might be cold and windy, but if you have trust in your guide the result could be an epic day of fishing! Rush steps up to the challenge and puts Ali on an incredible bite of mutton snapper while also checking another species off of Ali's bucket list!

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Escape to the beautiful shores of Grand Isle, Louisiana where musician and community advocate David St. Romain joins Chef Jay Ducote for a weekend of fishing, crabbing, and oyster harvesting. Watch as Chef Mark Boudreaux of Hurricane Hole transforms their fresh catch into a culinary feast. Enjoy the thrill of fishing, the joy of cooking and the camaraderie of camp in The Bayou State.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Cajun classics are met with a Zimbabwean flair in this delicious mashup of cultures. Join Chef Jay Ducote and Food Network Star Rue Lindsay as they take on the fishing village of Cocodrie, Louisiana. Guided by Captain Zach LeBeouf, this tasty adventure will surely leave you hankering for more.

programme.title: Tidewater Diaries
programme.desc: In this episode, Captain C.A. is reminiscing with The Mogan Man, Blair Wiggins. Blair has over 20 years of television experience where hes flipped inshore fishing upside down. Watch along as they relive the formative years and discuss a lifetime of fishing!
Joe Miles Owner of Asio Gear, chases big whitetails in Kentucky, Kansas and Mexico!
Kris and Flint Seymour hunt down a Kansas giant!
After filming his son kill his first 200 monster, Kris Seymour chases big bucks in Kansas, Oklahoma and Canada.

This week we celebrate the 40th Anniversary of Lone Wolf stands and the man that started it all, the Lone Wolf himself Andrae DAcquisto. As we take a look back at Andraes career, how it all started and where its heading after 4 decades, Andrae shares some insights on his hunting strategies and the equipment he has designed that made him one of the top bowhunters in the country!
Adam and Logan Hays chase big bucks in the Buckeye State!
Tarif Alkhatib hunts a couple giant whitetails in his home state of Texas!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Episode one hits close to home. Specifically, Joshs hometown of Seattle where we travel from the mountains to the coast in pursuit of local ingredients for an authentic Washington meal. Digging for forest delicacies, hunting for exotic bivalves, and exploring the tidal flats of a multi-generational shellfish farmits all on the menu.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisianas only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his familys traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, hell meet plenty of farmers and foragersharvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. Thats where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredientsfrom sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintans kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float planea new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, the land of earth, sea, and sky. All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaskas abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. Therell be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for nowjoin usthere are halibut to filet, rainforest shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Episode one hits close to home. Specifically, Joshs hometown of Seattle where we travel from the mountains to the coast in pursuit of local ingredients for an authentic Washington meal. Digging for forest delicacies, hunting for exotic bivalves, and exploring the tidal flats of a multi-generational shellfish farmits all on the menu.

programme.title: Bonefish & Tarpon Trust
programme.desc: Watch the video to learn more about bonefish and tarpon connectivity and the importance of conservation at local and regional levels.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: In Part 2, Day 2, Mark Peterson continues his quest to complete the Upland Slam of 27 bird species in a series only available on YouTube, The Journey Within A Bird Hunters Diary. Mark is in Alaska hunting the three species of ptarmigan; willow ptarmigan, white-tailed ptarmigan and rock ptarmigan. This is a two part episode where Mark is hunting with his father Earl as they cover miles of rocky terrain in search of these elusive birds in the high elevations of Alaska.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark is still on the South Island of New Zealand chasing the Wingshooting Slam. Its Mark's last day to complete the waterfowl portion of the slam and he still needs a Black Swan and a Shoveler. This hunt is taking place on a freshwater lake right off the ocean. The temperature is unusually warm for this time of year, but thankfully that hasnt affected the numbers of birds around.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: It's day 2 in Wyoming and Mark Peterson is hunting the opening day of Sage Grouse with his dad, Earl. Join them and their dogs on this high elevation Sage Grouse hunt, covering some of the best grouse habitat in the country.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: The last hunt in this series takes us to Texas in February of 2017. This time Mark is after his first Aoudad with a muzzleloader. Aoudad were introduced to Texas as an exotic species and it didn't take long for them to establish a large viable population in the ideal habitat that West Texas offers. Going into this hunt with the confidence and extended range that only Gunwerks can provide, Mark knows the odds are in his favor and it doesn't take long to come across multiple bands of rams. Thanks for following along in this 3 part series as we looked back on some of Mark's most memorable hunts for these incredible animals found all over the world. Click the link below to join and learn more about The Wild Sheep Foundation.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: In Part 3, Day 3, Mark Peterson wraps up his time in Wyoming upland hunting with an epic partridge hunt. Does he run into some chukars along the way? Take a look inside this episode to find out!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Petersons Journey in Argentina continues with some morning madness. Taking four animals, this is one of the best morning hunts he has had yet. After an already incredible week of hunting, Mark is looking for a few species that caught his attention earlier in the trip and turns up a Hybrid Sheep, Hybrid Mouflon, Feral Goat and a Multi Horn Sheep. Temps are abnormally hot in Argentina for this time of year and the animals will be heading for cover by mid day to stay cool. Mark and his guide Charley make a plan to cover a lot of ground in hopes of catching them out feeding before they disappear.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: In Part 4, Mark Peterson ventures to South Dakota for prairie chickens and sharp-tailed grouse. South Dakota is well known as the pheasant hunting capital of the world, but with its rolling prairie lands, also holds great habitat and numbers of prairie chicken and sharp-tail grouse. Take a look as Mark chases both and find out if he connects.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is known as the Slam guy. He has completed the North America and South America Waterfowl slams, each in a single season. After some thought and due diligence, Mark is now embarking on a journey to complete one of the most diverse slams there is, The New Zealand Wingshooting Slam. Mark starts this journey with his 828 U Benelli, going after turkey and quail.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: Mark and Earl set out to check species number 21, the chukar, off their upland slam list. Typically chukars live at higher elevations making it an earned feat to harvest one. Can Mark and Earl battle steep rocky terrain at over 4000 feet in elevation? Stay tuned for more The Journey Within Episodes every Thursday. We are getting close with Mark only needing to harvest another 6 species!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's early November and Mark Peterson heads north of the border to Saskatchewan to chase down his Northwestern whitetail. Unseasonably cold temps are staring Mark in the face and it has the deer hunkered down for a day and a half, but the power of food prevailed. On day two, with only 8 minutes left of shooting light, Mark's target buck showed up.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: Mark Peterson and his father, Earl, travel down to the great state of Kansas in hops to knock another quail species off their list. The North American Bobwhite Quail hold very tight and fly spastically from their covey. River bottoms and thick grasslands are the habitat of choice of these fast fliers. A river crossing and a broken up covey allow Mark to check the Bobwhite Quail off his list. Only a few species left to complete the Journey Within - A bird Hunters Diary!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is duck hunting for the 4th day in Argentina and finds that luck is on his side. He and Matt head to a blind for an early morning hunt in hopes of getting a Black Headed Duck before they disappear for the day in the reeds. He also still needs a Red Shoveler, but things take a quick turn while he is walking through the marsh, about to call it a day. Enjoy this episode of The Journey Within

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and the new producer (Tim Guidroz) go out on their first turkey hunt together, and even though the weather is not ideal, they get the job done on a Wilkinson County gobbler. We also get a look at what the United Country - Southern States Realty office looks like during turkey season, with interviews from Scott Lindsey and Caleb Armstrong, and three big properties closing in Baton Rouge.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade takes Bentley on his very first duck hunt. Slade also gets to take a trip to duck hunting paradise with some great buddies of his. This episode is all about having a great time with great friends.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes us through his new investment property, and breaks downwhats involved in taking a raw land tract and creating extremely desirable turn-keyhunting properties.Caleb and Slade double up on some Wilkinson County gobblers for Calebs first turkeykill ever.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade gets very busy in the real estate world. But lucky for him, Caleb Armstrong takes up the slack. Caleb sets out to hunt swamp bucks on the public land of Tensas Parish.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode we take you behind the scenes of production for one of the biggest and baddest listings Slade has ever gotten - Southside Land Company in Jefferson County, MS. Hunter Phelps comes down from Kentucky to help film, and Slade puts him on 2 Mississippi gobblers.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade goes over what hes doing at his home property to create summer food plots for deer, and gives tips to those looking to do the same. On the final hunt for the 2024 season, Lori gets a big Wilkinson County gobbler.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade is staying busy busy around the house, lots of testing on summer plots with Deergro and Backwoods bachelor pad blend. Also, there locally he takes a quick look at the new 60 acres he and Ryan bought as an investment property. Then ends with a throwback hunt from under the barn.

programme.title: HUnting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his brother Tai take us around a new investment property - a 55 acre tract in Wilkinson County, MS and go over what it took to take an undesirable raw tract, to a place with multiple offers on the first day it was put on the market.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Watch as Lori tags her first turkey of the season as well as the daily grind and comments from the office in McComb, Mississippi. The ladies in the office isnt too fond of turkey season until its their turn.

programme.title: Peggy Sue Got Married
programme.desc: An unhappy woman named Peggy Sue tries to change her future when she inadvertently travels back in time to her senior year of high school.

programme.title: Love Letters
programme.desc: A U.S. Senator reflects back on his life after the death of a woman he loved dearly but left behind in order to pursue his political ambitions.

programme.title: The First Time
programme.desc: What begins as a casual chat turns into something more complex, as a romance blooms between a high school junior and a senior on his way to college.

programme.desc: Megan Valentine was America's sweetheart. After the movie star suddenly becomes broke, she joins the Army, learning to live a life without luxury.

programme.title: The Throwaways
programme.desc: After a shrewd hacker is captured by the CIA, he agrees to work with them as long as he gets to pick the members of his ragtag team.

programme.title: Fast Getaway
programme.desc: A falling out within a bank robbing foursome splits up the group and pits a father and his 16-year-old son against their vengeful former partners.

programme.title: I Spy
programme.desc: Two mismatched partners, a pro boxer and a federal spy, must avoid international intrigue and deadly traps in order to get back an expensive jet.

programme.title: Guarding Tess

programme.title: Peggy Sue Got Married

programme.title: Finding Graceland
programme.desc: A grieving and guilt-ridden recent widower finds himself on a road trip to Memphis after picking up a hitchhiker who claims hes Elvis Presley.

programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: Based on the book The Three Stooges: From Amalgamated Morons to American Icons, this MOW dramatizes the rise of the comedy trio to worldwide fame.

programme.title: Side Out
programme.desc: In this high-spirited tribute to the California lifestyle, its a summer of fun when Monroe and Zack hit Malibu Beach for a volleyball tournament.

programme.title: I Walk the Line
programme.desc: A sheriff falls in love with a teen whose father is a moonshiner, and falls in danger when as a result, accidentally becomes an accomplice to murder.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: The Incredible Journey of Doctor Meg Laurel
programme.desc: An intrepid young doctor returns to her roots to open a practice in Appalachia, where her modern medicine clashes with the locals home-spun remedies.

programme.title: Heartsounds
programme.desc: A near-fatal heart attack sends a New York urologist and his writer wife into a battle against a medical institution unable or unwilling to help him.

programme.title: Wind
programme.desc: The open seas are ripe for adventure and romance as a man does his best to win the Americas Cup for the U.S. in a string of yacht races.

programme.title: The Big Heat
programme.desc: A police officer seems to have committed suicide, but Detective Dave Bannion (Glenn Ford) thinks there's more to the story. After talking to the man's mob-connected mistress, Bannion discovers far-reaching corruption that leads all the way from the police station to kingpin Mike Lagana (Alexander Scourby). But when the policeman's lover is killed, it becomes clear that crossing Lagana is a dangerous thing to do. Soon Bannion finds himself marked for death and his family in mortal danger.

programme.title: From Here to Eternity
programme.desc: A World War II classic about the violence, quarrels, and romantic intrigue affecting a group of soldiers at Pearl Harbor before the tragic attack.

programme.title: Walk, Don't Run
programme.desc: During the Olympics, an electronics expert learns his hotel room will not be available for two days, and is forced to share an apartment with a woman.

programme.title: There's That Woman Again
programme.desc: A district-attorney employee worries about his wife's activities as an amateur sleuth.

programme.title: Sword of Sherwood Forest
programme.desc: After infiltrating a group of insurrectionists, Greene discovers their plan to murder the Archbishop of Canterbury and to take over Bawtry Castle.

programme.title: It Had to Be You
programme.desc: Society girl Victoria Stafford (Ginger Rogers) garners a reputation for leaving men at the altar. Getting engaged for a fourth time, Victoria believes she's found the right man -- until on a train she has a strange dream about a Native American who claims that he is her true love. Awakening, Victoria is startled to find the dream man, George (Cornel Wilde), who claims to really exist, while also being a figment of her imagination. Back at home, George guides Victoria to a startling discovery.

programme.title: Gidget (1959)
programme.desc: Sandra Dee became a model for countless teenagers in the late 1950's when she played Gidget, a sad-faced youngster who doesn't quite measure up to the chesty, bikinied girls on the beach. Her mom's reassurances come true when two surfers start paying Gidget some attention.

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Man
programme.desc: Clumsy sanitation worker Red Jones (Red Skelton) is fired from his street-cleaning job shortly after his girlfriend, Ann Elliot (Janet Blair), refuses his marriage proposal until he betters himself. While training to become a door-to-door salesman, he accidentally stumbles into a murder investigation when the corrupt sanitation commissioner (Nicholas Joy) who had fired him is killed. When the murder weapon is found to be one of the brushes Red sells, he must fight to prove his innocence.

programme.title: The Mating of Millie
programme.desc: A businesswoman (Evelyn Keyes) asks a bachelor (Glenn Ford) to help her find a husband so she can adopt an orphan.

programme.title: The Cockleshell Heroes
programme.desc: During World War II, feuding leaders train British recruits for a risky covert mission to blow up a giant battleship in an enemy-held French port.

programme.title: What a Woman!
programme.desc: An author (Willard Parker) and a literary agent (Rosalind Russell) become involved after selling film rights to his racy book.

programme.title: Good Neighbor Sam
programme.desc: A happily married advertising agent helps out his single neighbor by posing as her husband so she can inherit a 15 million dollar fortune.

programme.title: From Here to Eternity
programme.desc: A World War II classic about the violence, quarrels, and romantic intrigue affecting a group of soldiers at Pearl Harbor before the tragic attack.

programme.desc: After her release from a three-month prison sentence, Kitty Lane becomes an overnight musical sensation and renews her romance with David Livingston.

programme.desc: An Irish immigrant who found a home in the Army as a West Point instructor becomes very close to his pupils, one of whom is Dwight Eisenhower.

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: When a kerfuffle over fine wine exports upends their tiny nation's economy, the prime minister and grand duchess of Fenwick declare war on the U.S.

programme.title: Affair in Trinidad
programme.desc: At the cost of damaging her relationship, a club dancer secretly works in cahoots with the cops to extract intel from a gang of international spies.

programme.title: Gidget Grows Up
programme.desc: When her boyfriend leaves for the Air Force without calling, Gidget heads to New York in the name of world peace and joins the U.N. as a tour guide.

programme.title: American Madness
programme.desc: During the Depression, the bank owned by generous Dickson (Walter Huston) is barely staying afloat, and things get worse when $100,000 is lifted from the vault. Fingers are pointed at reformed crook Matt (Pat O'Brien), who got a job and a fresh start from Dickson. The innocent Matt can clear his name by admitting that on the night of the robbery he was breaking up a tryst between Dickson's wife and another teller. But this revelation may crush Dickson, and Matt's conscience plays tug-of-war.

programme.title: The Trouble with Angels

programme.title: Texas Cyclone
programme.desc: A traveling cowboy visits an unusual town where everyone assumes he is a man who was once presumed to be dead, including the mans wife.

programme.title: Ride Beyond Vengeance
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Al Dewlen.

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: The Hellions
programme.desc: A small-town policeman (Richard Todd) stands alone against a family of outlaws in 19th-century South Africa.

programme.title: The Man From Colorado
programme.desc: In Colorado at the end of the Civil War, Col. Owen Devereaux (Glenn Ford), affected by four years of brutal bloodshed, orders the massacre of a Confederate unit, even as they try to surrender. Devereaux's friend and second in command, Capt. Del Stewart (William Holden), is the only one aware of the surrender attempt. Devereaux returns home to a hero's welcome and is appointed a judge, yet his irrational and angry behavior continues, affecting his fiance, Caroline (Ellen Drew), as well as Del.

programme.title: Massacre Canyon
programme.desc: A cavalry officer and two of his men set out to make sure that a shipment of guns safely reaches its destination.

programme.title: The Man From Tumbleweeds
programme.desc: Ex-convict gunfighters join a state ranger (Bill Elliott) on patrol for outlaws.

programme.title: Major Dundee
programme.desc: During the end of the Civil War, Major Dundee guards Confederate prisoners, Union deserters and ordinary hard-bitten criminals in a remote fort. When Apaches attack the fort and make off with three children, Dundee must set up a posse including Confederates, who face a choice between joining up or being shot. The feud between Dundee and Tyreen is also heated up by a sultry Mexican widow.

programme.title: The Palomino
programme.desc: Steve Norris (Jerome Courtland), the heir to a meat-packing fortune, has a yearning to set out and forge a path of his own. His rebellious streak leads him to the broken down horse-breeding farm of the bewitching beauty Maria Guevara (Beverly Tyler). Enchanted by this determined young woman, Norris decides to assist her in saving her business. But this enrages duplicitous rival breeder Ben Lane (Roy Roberts), who steals away Guevara's prize palomino in an attempt to cripple her operation.

programme.title: The Parson and the Outlaw
programme.desc: Billy the Kid (Anthony Dexter) retires from the outlaw life, fakes his own death and adopts the name William Bonney. Soon, William runs into Jack Slade (Sonny Tufts), a gun-toting stranger who is itching for a gunfight. Jack falls in with a group of thugs terrorizing William's town. The Rev. Jericho Jones (Buddy Rogers) exhorts William to defend the townspeople, and, when William's maid, Tonya (Marie Windsor), is beaten by the thugs, he grabs his pistol.

programme.title: The Return of Wild Bill
programme.desc: Wild Bill Saunders comes home to help his father deal with troublesome ranchers.

programme.title: Thomasine & Bushrod
programme.desc: In this beloved Blaxploitation flick set in 1911, a team of thieves steal from wealthy capitalists, to return their riches to deserving families.

programme.title: The Son of Davy Crockett
programme.desc: President Ulysses S. Grant enlists a frontiersman's son to help insure the inclusion of Texas into the Union.

programme.title: The Texican
programme.desc: Deputy Jess Carlin (Audie Murphy) leaves his Texas hometown in disgrace, framed by corrupt saloon owner Luke Starr (Broderick Crawford) for a crime he didn't commit. When his brother, muckraking newspaper editor Roy Carlin (Vctor Vilanova), is murdered after printing an expos of Starr's crooked deals, Carlin returns home from the Mexican border town where he's been holed up and enlists his brother's fiance (Luz Mrquez) and saloon dancer Kit O'Neal (Diana Lorys) to bring Starr down.

programme.desc: An Apache curse hangs over good guys (Valerie French, William Prince) and a villain (Raymond Burr) seeking Spanish gold.

programme.desc: Flaming arrows stop four ex-convicts searching a ghost town for their buried loot.

programme.title: Bones

programme.desc: Brennan and Booth investigate the college-basketball world to determine who is responsible for the murder of a player on a nationally ranked team.

programme.desc: Jack receives an emergency distress signal from one of his old Delta buddies who has been accused of terrorism in a foreign country; MacGyver and Jack quickly recruit the rest of Jack's old Delta team and stage an unsanctioned rescue operation.

programme.title: MacGyver

programme.desc: MacGyver and Riley must find a way to drive a tanker filled with liquid oxygen through a region occupied by rebels and deliver it to a children's hospital; Riley helps MacGyver decide whether or not to allow his father back into his life.

programme.title: MacGyver

programme.desc: Murdoc abducts MacGyver's girlfriend to force Mac to help him rescue his son from a kidnapper; a dangerous person from Murdoc's personal life shows up, giving Mac a glimpse into the villain's past.

programme.desc: Matty sends the team to Ghana to recover a hard drive from an e-waste landfill that is run by a powerful and violent man, leading them to speculate about what could be on the device.

programme.desc: When a vial containing a deadly virus is stolen from the Center for Disease Control in Atlanta, MacGvyer and team race to recover it before the thief unleashes a global pandemic.

programme.desc: A home invasion turns into something more when the team discovers that the Russian mob is targeting the group.

programme.title: CSI: Miami

programme.desc: Toby and Michelle investigate the death of a pharmaceutical executive who released a drug with killer results.

programme.desc: Violent home invasions are being interrupted by a citizen dressed as a superhero.

programme.desc: Oz puts his life in danger after asking Toby to help an old friend who witnessed a murder.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: The team must prove Michelle was set up after a suspect is shot.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a man impersonating Lasalle attempts to free a young woman from jail, the team investigates both the impostor and the prisoner; Pride's daughter pays him a surprise visit.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Racial tensions rise in New Orleans when a white officer shoots a black Navy officer he believed was armed in the middle of a busy street party.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a Navy sailor is found dead, the team tracks the suspicious movements of people in his life prior to his death; Hannah comes to terms with her daughter's relationship with her ex's new girlfriend.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When Sebastian is injured while unsuccessfully trying to prevent a kidnapping, NCIS races to find the missing woman and her abductors; the team gets a peek into Agent Carter's personal life.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a Naval microbiologist whose hobby as a "myth buster" resulted in his death at the hands of a legendary bayou creature; Agent Khoury conducts an investigation into previous actions of Deputy Director Van Cleef.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: As New Orleans grapples with the effects of COVID-19, Pride sends Tammy and Carter to investigate a suspicious death aboard an offshore humanitarian ship; Wade is overwhelmed by the high volume in the morgue due to COVID-19.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Tammy and Carter continue to investigate a suspicious death aboard a COVID-infected humanitarian ship; Pride and the team discover what may be the key to finding the killer; Wade helps a grieving woman.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride and the team take on a group of dirty cops when they discover that a murder victim was also a key witness in multiple excessive force cases; Tammy faces the reality of being in a new relationship.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team continue to investigate the murder of an officer who was about to blow the whistle on police misconduct; Pride must get creative in order to finally get rid of the dirty cops; the mayor asks Pride to join her new task force.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers in Elverton-cum-Latterly are up in arms and divided, over the building of a supermarket. Things soon come to a head when independent environmental supervisor, Frank Hopkirk, is found stabbed to death at a Jubb's Timber Yard, the site of the new supermarket, by a pair of children. When Barnaby and Jones investigate to determine who wanted Hopkirk dead, they find out that he secretly came to the village under various aliases for sexual rendezvous with various women in fantasy role-playing scenarios, and that he had been making further investigations on the future development site and having doubts over claims it was contaminated. Either someone didn't like his investigations, or someone didn't like his sexual appetite, but either way, Barnaby finds himself investigating lies and more to uncover the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and DC Ben Jones (Jason Hughes) find themselves attempting to unravel the deaths of a choir tenor, and later a bird watcher, before more murders occur. The case is complicated by a rivalry between the Midsomer Worthy and Aston Wherry choirs, due to compete in an upcoming competition, and suspicions that an art scam is to be conducted, and soon Barnaby and Jones become concerned about a local woman, who they fear may become a victim herself. Particularly when it becomes clear the bird watcher had been photographing suspicious activity of late.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A few months ago, Annie Woodrow was arrested, accused of murdering her friend, Frances Trevelyan, on the motive of wanting Frances' husband. Her time in court has come, but DCI Barnaby is certain she still is holding things back in regards to the murder, and decides to monitor the trial. Yet a chance remark by Frances' youngest daughter, and a meeting with an old friend and psychiatrist, makes him begin to doubt the evidence for her conviction. Soon he and DC Jones, awaiting news of his promotion to DS, find themselves reinvestigating the case, and it soon becomes clear that they may have missed details that could implicate another in the murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Plans by Barnaby to renew his wedding vows at the church of St Michael's in Badger's Drift, are quickly put on hold when the body of Richard Bayly, a local developer, is found decapitated in his own home. The detective is left mystified as to why anyone would kill a man who had only been given weeks to live, after being recently diagnosed with a brain tumour. As he and Troy attempt to find out, they soon encounter a hotbed of corruption and property feuding occurring within the village as the body count rises and the mystery deepens.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Carla Constanza - the face of Brazil's leading cigarette brand for Monarch Tobacco - is found strangled in the infamous Strangler's Wood, Barnaby and Troy not only find themselves investigating her murder, but three identical unsolved murders of innocent girls from eight years before.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Cully's latest boyfriend, Nico, decides to shadow Troy in preparation for a TV role he recently got, but gets more hands-on experience than he expected when investigations into a slashed painting at a museum in Aspern Tallow, a 17th century portrait of Royalist Jonathan Lowrie, are overshadowed by the murder of his descendant, Marcus Lowrie. It isn't long before Barnaby and Troy, with Nico's assistance, find themselves dealing with mysterious, ghostly events, escaped criminals, and a museum trustee who has more to them than meets the eye.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Hector Bridges, a local magistrate, is infuriated when one of his geese is stolen, just as two bands of travellers arrive in Martyr Warren. Although Barnaby and Troy are called in to deal with the theft and later dissuade him from forcefully evicting the travellers from the village, they soon have a murder on their hands, when a short while later Bridges is killed with his own shotgun. It quickly transpires that many in the village had hated the magistrate, who lied, bullied, and committed many an injustice, leaving the detectives determined to find who among them had pulled the trigger after Bridges pushed them past their breaking point.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: New DCI John Barnaby arrives in Midsomer and is bemused by the quaint villages and their quirky residents. But when a local DJ is crushed to death at a traditional girls' boarding school, he soon discovers that murder and deception are never far away. As the death toll rises, could Barnaby's first case also be his last?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The reclusive lives of elderly eccentrics William and Mary Bingham (Edward Fox and Phyllida Law) comes under police scrutiny when a social services investigator (Jeff Rawle) is murdered. Barnaby and Jones must unearth generations of family secrets and decipher astronomical charts to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a young woman is dressed like a bride and drowned in a bath, it triggers a spate of ghoulish wedding-themed murders in Great Worthy. The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-copper and former brothel madam. With the serial killer still at large, could history be repeating itself?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Jones goes undercover at the Oblong Foundation after one of the cult's young female members disappears suddenly. But he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In Midsomer Mow, the gruesome discovery of a farmer's eviscerated body in an ancient stone circle is made just days before the spring equinox.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A VAT inspector goes missing as he hunts for an illicit cider still responsible for brewing The Beast, a potent local hooch. At the Midsomer Abbas spring fayre which celebrates its friendship with Midsomer Herne, Barnaby and Jones sample the local cider, while temperance preacher Norman Grigor calls on residents to repent of their drunken ways. Suddenly, Barnaby is violently ill as the body of missing man Peter Slim is found floating in the cider vat. Meanwhile Samuel Quested (Warren Clarke), the traditionalist mayor of Midsomer Abbas, seeks to revive the ancient rite known as 'The Stag'.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the cloistered world of Midsomer Priory when a nun is strangled to death. The detectives uncover a complex mystery involving holy orders, teenage romantic liaisons, African art and missing antique silver as the community is forced to open its doors to 21st-century policing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A row between keen birdwatchers in Midsomer-in-the-Marsh turns nasty when their president is killed. Patrick Morgan met his death while hoping to sight a rare bird, but is his obsession with ornithology to blame - or something more sinister?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is killed after receiving threatening letters, setting off a chain of murders for DCI Barnaby to investigate.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Midsomer Wellow, someone is killing off the bell ringers of the parish church, in the week before a big bell-ringing competition. One young woman on the team is even shot dead in the churchyard on her wedding day.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Some of the residents of Midsomer Worthy are trying to prevent James Harrington from turning Setwale Woods into a housing estate. Led by a solicitor, Bernadette Sullivan, and a local farmer, Simon Bartlett, who also happen to be having an affair, they haven't had much success in court. When Bartlett's wife Victoria is found dead in the woods, Barnaby and Troy must first determine is if her murder is related to the planned development or something as yet unknown. The information provided by two inquisitive children, who see the investigation as a fascinating game, proves invaluable in solving the crime.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An investigation of a car fire and a bludgeon murder lead Barnaby and Troy to investigate the members of a local reading club which has an agenda that goes beyond books.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby investigates the murder of a boy during a traditional annual race at an exclusive private school but meets with resentment.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer is buzzing with excitement at the arrival of the annual Paramount Dance Extravaganza. But behind the sequins and smiles are deep running feuds and passions.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Prolific real estate agent Alexander Beauvoisin is murdered in front of a crowd at the unveiling of a new dolls house collection at Midsomer Museum of the family.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Deddingtons thriving bee Empire has put Granville Norton on the map, but what lengths will they go to to ensure theyre never dethroned

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Fishermen and women flock to the village of Solomon Gorge desperate to catch a giant fish that is said to lurk in the lake.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: No one could suspect that a prestigious golf club would be the setting for murder, but when one of the major members is found dead, bludgeoned to death in a thicket next to the 13th hole, Barnaby and Jones try to determine what made him leave the fairway. It seems the club has a rift between the snobbish members, and local villagers, the latter only allowed onto the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another member turns up dead, and the detectives soon find the club has a hidden history, involving gambling, illegal money lending and assault, prompting the pair to determine if a club member, or one of its staff, is responsible for the deeds.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A newly discovered masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for 400,000 - just hours before its former owner is tortured and killed. When another Hogson is stolen, Barnaby decides to become an expert on the Midsomer painter, with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms (Susannah Harker). He soon realises the paintings are not what they seem - but the death toll is rising.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny must give up his prized 1972 Monte Carlo for one of his biggest clients, and is counting on his team to get the job done in one week.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny sunk a lot of time into a 1967 Ford Bronco, but to make any profit, the shop will have to turn it around quickly; a customer brings in a 1950 Harley Davidson; Danny gets a chance to go for a spin in a 1966 Corvette Sting Ray.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has a customer all lined up to buy his 1967 Ford Bronco he's restoring, but Ryan's mistake has set the project way back.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: When Danny is asked to create a commemorative bike that honors music legend Les Paul he has to pull out all the stops.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny wants Ryan to fix a bad flame job on his beloved police cruiser that's been sitting in the shop for years.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny scores a 1967 Mustang that he hopes he can turn into another Count's Kustoms masterpiece. He visits a local muscle car collection for inspiration.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny makes a plan to put the Count's Kustoms touch on a classic Harley Davidson that he hopes to sell for a big profit.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny builds an extra special car for a customer who wants something no one else has--a tribute car of the rare Yenko Nova.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A motorcycle-loving couple wants to hit the road like they used to, this time on a Count's Kustoms chopper.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the gang head to the Las Vegas Speedway for Ford Mustang's 50th Anniversary Celebration.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The huge photo shoot day for the Count's Kustoms calendar is approaching.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny decides to feature the 12 favorite cars in his collection in an official Count's Kustoms calendar.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny is so proud of the van he restored as a gift for his bandmate John Zito, that he decides to give his own classic van a make-over.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny sees something in his shop that makes him very uncomfortable, emptiness.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A Casino VIP visits Count's Kustoms to commission a hi-end chopper build for a huge blackjack bonus prize.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Count's Kustoms has had its most successful year to date.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Inspired by the Rat Rods at a local shop, Danny sends the guys out to find parts for a Count's Kustoms Rat Rod.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Music industry royalty, Del Bryant has a Blazer he wants to pay tribute to his Tennessee roots.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny gets a call from Kevin's brother who wants to sell Danny a 1969 Cadillac, but they can't let Kevin know or else he'll never trust his brother or Danny again.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Kevin and the team come together to make something special for Danny. Meanwhile Danny runs into an old pal and his 1959 Corvette gasser.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Royalty rolls across the Barrett-Jackson block as the queen's private limousine goes under the hammer at no reserve; the action amplifies as a classic Hemi 'Cuda gets the Las Vegas crowd betting big.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Classics and customs roll across the Barrett-Jackson block; the six-figure sales are non-stop as a wide selection of vintage vehicles go under the hammer at no reserve.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: A custom "boater-home" goes under the hammer at no reserve; the auction action intensifies when a 1970 Dodge Challenger HEMI creates a bidding frenzy.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Featuring incredible restorations and customs cars; Broncos, Beetles, MOPARs, and Mercedes.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The Vegas strip heats up as a pair of Shelby Mustangs light up the Barrett-Jackson auction, selling at no reserve; a Boss 429 Mustang gallops into a block-busting bidding war.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The World's Greatest Collector Car Auction concludes in Las Vegas with another incredible assortment of the finest collector cars, all selling at no reserve. Later, brace yourself for a Plymouth HEMI Superbird that blows past the million dollar mark!

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: 3-2-1...takeoff! The world-famous Barrett-Jackson Collector Car Auction launches from Houston, Texas with intrepid car enthusiasts bidding on heavenly vehicles selling for astronomical figures.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: At Rygaard, a crew shakeup leaves everyone scrambling; S&S suffers a blow; Buck and Swilley get unexpected help from James; Papac takes to the open seas for a fishing trip; Big Gun brings in a new yarder operator.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jimmy Smith braves the depths of the Suwannee River; Shelby takes on a log that flipped his winch last season; the boys of Siderius play fast and loose; Rygaard pushes their yarder to the brink of disaster.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe's two yarder sides are reunited; the alliance between team Buck and James Smith comes to a bitter end; Joe's hard-yarding style sends the rigging crew running for cover; two new teams of ox loggers enter the race.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby finds something that could lead to the biggest payday ever; Craig and Wayne plot a prank to teach Dave a lesson; personality differences between the ox loggers cause walk-offs on both sides; James returns to S&S.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby chases buried gold in Lake Ponchartrain; a surprising end to the log-off forces sudden death in Florida; a greenhorn's mistake could cost Big Gun's season's profits; the ox loggers and cowboys of Siderius fight to finish their seasons strong.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Pushing hard pushes Joe to his breaking point; Dave wears out his welcome at Rygaard; the teams fight to win the final round of the log-off in the Suwannee; bad blood between Jimmy and James comes to a head.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Papac battles to bring the yarder operator back from the brink; Craig forces Gabe to choose between himself and Dave; Levi drops a bomb; the Great Suwannee River Log-Off comes to a close.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby Stanga searches for a million-dollar payday; S&S Aqua Logging gets a new captain; Rygaard Logging returns with a surprising new addition; the rowdy boys of Papac Alaska begin another season.

programme.title: Ax Men

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe faces a crew mutiny; the guys at Lemare put their chaser to the test; Shelby and Belinda take to the open road to bring home a money log; James Smith lashes out against his own crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby builds his new empire one big toy at a time; the men of S&S Aqua Logging deal with last week's fallout; DJ suffers an injury that could take him out of the season; a whole new kind of logging.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Dreadknots come face-to-face with one of the most fearsome creatures in the river; Shelby and Donna put his new paddle barge to work; DJ returns to work but faces another battle with Craig; the Woodchucks push hard to meet their deadline.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby puts his new toys to work and discovers a huge payday in his own backyard; runaway logs send Craig over the edge; Joe and Coatsy strike out on their own; the Woodchucks battle a crumbling wall ; Jimmy Smith says goodbye.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: DJ Jeremiah is pushed to his breaking point; Coatsy boots Joe Linderborg from his seat in the yarder; the Dreadknots find themselves on the wrong end of a falling log; Shelby and his assistants fight to claim the biggest Cypress of the season.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Three years of tension between Craig and DJ comes to a head; the Swamp Man goes on a special mission for his wife; the end of the North Thorn site may mean the end of the season at Papac; the Dreadknots are in the line of fire.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe's two-yarder plan goes further off track when one crew member defects to the other team; Big Gun races their tightest deadline yet; Joe and the new guy get into it; an accident could take S&S out of the Log-Off for good.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: At Rygaard, a crew shakeup leaves everyone scrambling; S&S suffers a blow; Buck and Swilley get unexpected help from James; Papac takes to the open seas for a fishing trip; Big Gun brings in a new yarder operator.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jimmy Smith braves the depths of the Suwannee River; Shelby takes on a log that flipped his winch last season; the boys of Siderius play fast and loose; Rygaard pushes their yarder to the brink of disaster.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe's two yarder sides are reunited; the alliance between team Buck and James Smith comes to a bitter end; Joe's hard-yarding style sends the rigging crew running for cover; two new teams of ox loggers enter the race.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby finds something that could lead to the biggest payday ever; Craig and Wayne plot a prank to teach Dave a lesson; personality differences between the ox loggers cause walk-offs on both sides; James returns to S&S.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby chases buried gold in Lake Ponchartrain; a surprising end to the log-off forces sudden death in Florida; a greenhorn's mistake could cost Big Gun's season's profits; the ox loggers and cowboys of Siderius fight to finish their seasons strong.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Pushing hard pushes Joe to his breaking point; Dave wears out his welcome at Rygaard; the teams fight to win the final round of the log-off in the Suwannee; bad blood between Jimmy and James comes to a head.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Papac battles to bring the yarder operator back from the brink; Craig forces Gabe to choose between himself and Dave; Levi drops a bomb; the Great Suwannee River Log-Off comes to a close.

programme.desc: Shelby Stanga searches for a million-dollar payday; S&S Aqua Logging gets a new captain; Rygaard Logging returns with a surprising new addition; the rowdy boys of Papac Alaska begin another season.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank are in Missouri, heading towards an inherited old farm with plenty of promise. But then Danielle calls with news about an ultimate prize.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While picking in Missouri, the guys stop in at Sam and Stan's steel yard where the father-son duo takes them on a high-speed golf cart tour of their massive hangar.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In upstate New York, the guys stop in at a sprawling treasure-laden farm with fourteen jam-packed trailers, the result of a lifetime of collecting by the late owner.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Concerned about slow sales and high expenses, Danielle tells the guys they need to step up their game and make some serious money. Mike and Frank feel the pressure.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A prop from "Back to the Future, Part II"; a chemical company calendar from 1900; a British Navy gunpowder bucket; a belt owned by country music legend Merle Haggard takes things up a notch.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A sword with an attached pistol from the 1700s; a portrait of legendary film and theater actor John Barrymore; an antique navigational timepiece used by ships in the 19th century; a 1969 Harley motorbike.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick flies to Washington, D.C., to see one of the first Jeeps built for use in WWII; a magic lantern image projector from the early 20th century; a fortune-telling gambling machine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Chum grapple with a Batman utility belt toy from the 1960s; a gorgeous Mosrite electric guitar shocks everyone at the shop; Rick continues his hunt for The Object, an item featured in the art for Led Zeppelin's album "Presence."

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller drums up excitement for his Led Zeppelin vinyl albums; an elaborate 19th-century office desk makes a formidable piece of furniture; a baseball base used in the 2016 World Series.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1984 Ferrari 308; a phone-operated music player from the 1930s; a cowboy hat that belonged to actor Larry Hagman ("Dallas"); a hockey jersey signed by goalie Marc-Andr Fleury, who visits the shop to authenticate his signature.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A top hat and pistol that belonged to a Jack the Ripper suspect; a 1920s time clock; Face to Face board game creator wants to sell the rights to the game along with his collection of celebrity signatures; a gold gnome stained glass lamp.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A pair of 18th-century breech-loading pistols; a paperweight made by glass artist Paul Stankard; a vest made to hold the 14 harmonicas of musician John Popper, who gives Chumlee a harmonica lesson.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An autographed card of President Abraham Lincoln; a golf driver shaft designed for President Bill Clinton; a personal check signed by President James Madison; a patent model for an American flag press.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys inspect an anti-war speech signed by Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., a remote-controlled miniature version of a boat from Disney's Jungle Cruise ride, a German Blue Max medal from WWI, and a 1950s Nikon camera.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller brings in an antique high wheel bike; Chumlee sells one of Rick's prized Japanese katanas to UFC President Dana White; Rick tries to score a restored grand piano from the 1800s and an original Walkman cassette player.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank are in Missouri, heading towards an inherited old farm with plenty of promise. But then Danielle calls with news about an ultimate prize.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While picking in Missouri, the guys stop in at Sam and Stan's steel yard where the father-son duo takes them on a high-speed golf cart tour of their massive hangar.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In upstate New York, the guys stop in at a sprawling treasure-laden farm with fourteen jam-packed trailers, the result of a lifetime of collecting by the late owner.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Concerned about slow sales and high expenses, Danielle tells the guys they need to step up their game and make some serious money. Mike and Frank feel the pressure.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A prop from "Back to the Future, Part II"; a chemical company calendar from 1900; a British Navy gunpowder bucket; a belt owned by country music legend Merle Haggard takes things up a notch.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A sword with an attached pistol from the 1700s; a portrait of legendary film and theater actor John Barrymore; an antique navigational timepiece used by ships in the 19th century; a 1969 Harley motorbike.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick flies to Washington, D.C., to see one of the first Jeeps built for use in WWII; a magic lantern image projector from the early 20th century; a fortune-telling gambling machine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Chum grapple with a Batman utility belt toy from the 1960s; a gorgeous Mosrite electric guitar shocks everyone at the shop; Rick continues his hunt for The Object, an item featured in the art for Led Zeppelin's album "Presence."

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller drums up excitement for his Led Zeppelin vinyl albums; an elaborate 19th-century office desk makes a formidable piece of furniture; a baseball base used in the 2016 World Series.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1984 Ferrari 308; a phone-operated music player from the 1930s; a cowboy hat that belonged to actor Larry Hagman ("Dallas"); a hockey jersey signed by goalie Marc-Andr Fleury, who visits the shop to authenticate his signature.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A top hat and pistol that belonged to a Jack the Ripper suspect; a 1920s time clock; Face to Face board game creator wants to sell the rights to the game along with his collection of celebrity signatures; a gold gnome stained glass lamp.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A pair of 18th-century breech-loading pistols; a paperweight made by glass artist Paul Stankard; a vest made to hold the 14 harmonicas of musician John Popper, who gives Chumlee a harmonica lesson.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An autographed card of President Abraham Lincoln; a golf driver shaft designed for President Bill Clinton; a personal check signed by President James Madison; a patent model for an American flag press.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys inspect an anti-war speech signed by Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., a remote-controlled miniature version of a boat from Disney's Jungle Cruise ride, a German Blue Max medal from WWI, and a 1950s Nikon camera.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller brings in an antique high wheel bike; Chumlee sells one of Rick's prized Japanese katanas to UFC President Dana White; Rick tries to score a restored grand piano from the 1800s and an original Walkman cassette player.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie gets a soft serve machine for himself, he tells the guys they can't use it until they're done working.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase finds out Jep is planning to buy his kids a fancy playhouse from a catalogue, he and the guys decide to build one for Jep them selves.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Sadie spends the day at Duck Commander for a school project, the guys try to show her the ins-and-outs of how a successful company works.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family pulls together a family reunion to give Mia a big send-off before her surgery.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family takes a look back at 130 episodes of Duck Dynasty,

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Rebecca returns home from her internship in Los Angeles, the Robertson family plans a big surprise party to welcome her back.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie is looking to hire a new assistant, Korie insists he interview her cousin, JD. Willie is hesitant at first, but immediately hits it off with JD, who truly appreciates Willie's sense of humor.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After seeing footage Jep shot using a GoPro, Si decides he wants to use the camera to record a day in his life. But when Si gets on the guys nerves while they're hunting, they kick him and his GoPros out of the blind.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the duck guys have to pull an all-nighter to finish some work, Willie decides he wants to join them. But when a dying smoke detector distracts them from their work.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After visiting a popular burger restaurant, Willie and Jase get into a debate over which of them cooks the best burger, prompting them to challenge one another to a cooking contest.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie and Jase argue over an old GI Joe toy, it leads them into a debate over who would make a better soldier.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie gets a soft serve machine for himself, he tells the guys they can't use it until they're done working.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Governor of Louisiana announces that he will be coming to Duck Commander to present Willie with a commerce award, John Luke volunteers to give the introduction speech.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Reed's graduation day approaching, Jase decides to take Reed frog hunting the night before, like he did on the day of his own graduation.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie agrees to sponsor Mountain Man's radio contest, a "Hands on a Hardbody" competition, he somehow finds himself competing against Si for Mountain Man's last minute prize.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Robertsons participate in the West Monroe Fire Department pancake breakfast, the firemen invite Willie and his brothers to train with the department for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie contemplates re-branding the Duck Commander image, Jase takes issue with having an outsider design their image.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys realize it is time for the annual cleaning of the duck blinds when they come across a gator using one as a home.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Brotherly competition is taken to a whole new level when Jase and Willie challenge Alan and Jep to a survival race through the woods on Phil's property.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Phil discovers more beaver activity on the Robertson land, he recruits Jase, Jep, and Si to get rid of them. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie bring Bella to her first day of karate practice.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Stumped on a way to celebrate Willie's birthday, Korie enlists the guys' help and Jase takes the reigns in planning a trip to the lake where Phil and Kay used to live.

programme.desc: When the Governor of Louisiana announces that he will be coming to Duck Commander to present Willie with a commerce award, John Luke volunteers to give the introduction speech.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Reed's graduation day approaching, Jase decides to take Reed frog hunting the night before, like he did on the day of his own graduation.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie agrees to sponsor Mountain Man's radio contest, a "Hands on a Hardbody" competition, he somehow finds himself competing against Si for Mountain Man's last minute prize.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Robertsons participate in the West Monroe Fire Department pancake breakfast, the firemen invite Willie and his brothers to train with the department for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie contemplates re-branding the Duck Commander image, Jase takes issue with having an outsider design their image.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys realize it is time for the annual cleaning of the duck blinds when they come across a gator using one as a home.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Brotherly competition is taken to a whole new level when Jase and Willie challenge Alan and Jep to a survival race through the woods on Phil's property.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Phil discovers more beaver activity on the Robertson land, he recruits Jase, Jep, and Si to get rid of them. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie bring Bella to her first day of karate practice.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Stumped on a way to celebrate Willie's birthday, Korie enlists the guys' help and Jase takes the reigns in planning a trip to the lake where Phil and Kay used to live.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie takes a business trip to Scotland to expand his duck call business, he brings the entire family along so they can reconnect with their Scottish roots.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A special holiday episode of Duck Dynasty shows when the Robertson family took over the Thanksgiving special of a local TV show "Good Morning Arklamiss."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie becomes the temporary owner of a thoroughbred, he and the guys take it to a local track and enter it into a race.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertsons help a long time employee whose Mom has fallen on hard times by buying her a brand new house for Christmas. Jep, Jase, Martin and Godwin race to finish a deck in time for the big reveal, only to get sidetracked by a hammering competition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase enters an outhouse race to help promote Willie's Duck Diner, but when the Robertsons show up for the race, they face an unexpected rival -- Phillip McMillan. Meanwhile, Willie attempts to create the world's greatest bologna sandwich for his Duck Diner menu, and enlists the help of the ladies to be his "taste testers."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie helps Sadie with her homework by enlisting the guys to create a real-life version of a math problem, but when Jase and Willie get sidetracked helping Sadie.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jep asks Willie and the guys to help move his old chicken coop into his new house, which is under renovation, Jessica takes issue with its appearance, leading the guys to yet another project.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie becomes an assistant coach on Lil' Will's struggling football team, his authority is tested when the kids challenge the adults to a scrimmage. Meanwhile, Kay brings Jep and Si to an aquarobics class at a local health club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys transform an old pontoon boat into a floating duck blind, they are faced with the impending question of whether or not it will actually float. Meanwhile, when Kay's dog Bobo misbehaves, Willie signs Kay and Bobo up for a doggie obedience class.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jep and Jessica move into Willie and Jase's neighborhood, Jep is sidelined with an illness, causing Willie and the Robertson family to pitch in and help Jessica get her new house ready in time for Jep's arrival home.

programme.desc: Victor and Angel make Lucas the star of this week's group performance, but dance mom Susan's outbursts put a damper on the whole studio. Meanwhile, Hannah and Sammy both have solos and must work to prove themselves as featured dancers.

programme.desc: Angel and Victor create a powerful group number based on the kids' uncertainties. And while the kids face their self-doubts, the tables suddenly turn when dance moms Brigette and Susan side with dance mom Abby.

programme.title: Abby's Ultimate Dance Competition
programme.desc: In this mother of all competition series, a dozen of the country's most talented kid dancers compete in weekly dance challenges. Twelve kids and their moms will move into a mansion and the kids will perform a new routine each week while the moms manage and oversee them. Will the moms get in the way of their child's success and cost them the chance of winning? Each week, someone is eliminated, narrowing down the field to see who will become the top dancer. The winner will receive a cash prize of $100,000 and a scholarship for full tuition to The Joffrey Ballet School. Dance Mom instructor Abby Lee Miller serves as one of the judges.

programme.title: Abby's Ultimate Dance Competition
programme.desc: When this life-changing competition kicks off the 12 finalists are tasked with their first live performance in front of judges including, Dance Moms Abby Lee Miller, Robin Antin, founder of the Pussycat Doll s dance troupe and celebrity choreographer, Richard "Richy" Jackson. The dancers are split into trios and assigned routines with a "Hollywood" theme. As the contestants prepare throughout the week, the moms start sizing each other up. Alliances begin to form, but when one mom takes charge during rehearsal, the other moms realize that she could be trouble. Plus, one mother and daughter team reveal just how far they re willing to go to win the competition.

programme.title: Abby's Ultimate Dance Competition
programme.desc: There are 11 dancers left and the theme for this week's competition is "Monsters of the Night." The theme proves to be very fitting as one mom bares her claws and strikes at another, who is using her divorce as a way to get attention. After witnessing that mom make one of the girls break into tears, two of the other mothers join forces and conjure up a demon, unleashing on the other mom claiming she is being fake. Also one of the girls wins the group dance challenge and gets a solo, but there must be a full moon because she brings out the beast in her mother who refuses to listen to her daughter's suggestions.

programme.title: Abby's Ultimate Dance Competition
programme.desc: This week, the 10 remaining dancers are assigned duets based on "American Extremes." One of the classically trained dancers struggles during her hip-hop duet. Meanwhile, another contestant's role in the group dance forces her to share painful memories with her fellow dancers. Plus, one mother's meddling threatens to send a team home.

programme.title: Abby's Ultimate Dance Competition
programme.desc: The nine remaining dancers are thrilled when they learn the theme for this week s performance is "Broadway." But when two mothers at odds team up, everyone prepares for the worst.

programme.title: Abby's Ultimate Dance Competition
programme.desc: After winning the right to pick all the dance assignments for the week, one mother takes this week's skill, survival, to heart.

programme.title: Dance Moms: Miami
programme.desc: Stars Dance Studio's best dancers Sammy and Jessi are paired with Hannah in a trio, but when rehearsals run long, dance mom Abby breaks the rules and pulls Sammy from practice early.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Lisa Kelly auditions to be the first woman to break into the elite Heavy Haul division by commanding a convoy of pilot cars while hauling 80-foot sections of wide-gauge pipe.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The race is on to make it to Prudhoe before a wicked storm turns fierce.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: A deadly combination of unpredictable weather on the North Slope has made Atigun Pass more dangerous than ever.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: With just three weeks to go, everyone is pushing it to the limit to get the freight to Deadhorse before the season ends. Lisa rushes to Carlile to pick up her next load.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: There's only two weeks left to pull in the big bucks and get all the loads to the oil fields.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The drivers are pushed to their limits when they must shuttle critical supplies to the oil camps of Alaska's North Slope.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The truckers and their rigs are running ragged as they race to pull in the last loads. Lisa can't get out of the Carlile yard in Fairbanks.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: As the final 72 hours of the Ice Road season tick away, legendary driver George Spears calls it a career, Lisa Kelly makes a harrowing 300-mile run with no brakes.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The Ice Road Truckers are back in action, and the roads are more dangerous than ever. Lisa's first run of the season goes south in a hurry.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With a long record of violence and abuse and weighing in at over 200lbs, Dog's target for the day does not sound like a gentle giant. When the trail grows cold Dog turns up the heat on the fugitive's brother and sister.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When Leland learns that one of his clients with a reputation for stealing has lost her co-signer and could be ready to run, Dog and the crew hop a plane to the Big Island.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is up in the high plains of Colorado helping a fellow bondman bring his most elusive fugitives to justice. When Dog discovers today's prey is a notorious ladies man, he knows just how to lure him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Both brother Tim and fellow Honolulu bondsman James need Dog's help to track down their hard to find fugitives. The two cases on the docket today are challenging, especially the hunt for Gregory, a felon with a lengthy rap sheet.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and company head to the Big Island in pursuit of two courthouse no-shows only to find that one of them appears to be posting status updates from Southern California.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Kolani's on the run, left his wife to look after four kids and left Dog holding the bag for the $10k bond. Apparently the lure of the streets and other women have drawn him away from his commitments.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: As Dog likes to say, "it's not the years it's the miles," and this goes for both men and machines. Those long hunts and the rides to jail take a toll not only on Dog but also on his vehicles.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's the day before Valentine's Day and love is in the air at Da Kine Bail Bonds--but not for Tapi who has failed to appear in court on theft charges. Dog's plan is to have Leland knock on Tapi's door with a Valentine's gift to draw her out.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is a rough, tough bounty hunter, but he's a softie at heart, as the two cases in this episode show. The first case involves Frankie, who's had a problem with methamphetamines.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog shows his love of justice and children in this poignant episode. He begins by giving encouragement to a group of handicapped children and making them honorary members of his posse.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With a long record of violence and abuse and weighing in at over 200lbs, Dog's target for the day does not sound like a gentle giant. When the trail grows cold Dog turns up the heat on the fugitive's brother and sister.
