programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and company head to the Big Island in pursuit of two courthouse no-shows only to find that one of them appears to be posting status updates from Southern California.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Denver and in hot pursuit of a woman wanted for identity theft. The sad reality is that the identify which has been robbed is her own. She's traded in a bright future for a life on the wrong side of the law.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Tim's got a big problem on his hands. One of his clients, Owen, has failed to appear in court. He's on bond for serious drug charges and now Tim could lose $30,000 if he doesn't catch Owen.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Baby Lyssa, who's just turned 18 and is studying to become a bondsman, gets to do some on-the-job training when she helps Dog hunt for Wayne, who's run out on a bond for second-degree assault.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The boys get distracted by the bikini-clad lovelies on Waikiki when they hunt for Lucy, a homeless, alcoholic fugitive. Beth is amused by the boys, but this is serious business: Tim will have to pay the bond if Lucy isn't caught.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the posse travel to the Big Island to help Leland track down a small-time Bonnie and Clyde couple. Their crime: theft, including allegedly stealing a pair of Buddha statues for resale. But this only masks deeper problems with the couple.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Dog and the family are back in Colorado and are about to make one of their most exciting captures ever. On his search he'll encounter a felon with history of violence and an alleged affection for sawed-off shotguns.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team have girl trouble in this case. Krystal jumped bail and seems to have vanished into the high plains of Colorado. To make matters worse, she's running with her lover (and bond co-signer) Carrie.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This fugitive has a bad reputation and a knack for running from the law. The pursuit has Dog and team traveling through an urban dystopia of suspicion, false leads and mistrust.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the Chapman clan start their hunt today.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has a big problem. Patty Estabilio has jumped a $15,000 bail bond and disappeared into Hawaii's underworld. Kissing the kids good night, Dog and Beth, with Tim and Leland at their side, plunge into a drug-infused netherworld.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Justin is the low man on the totem pole in the Chapman clan, and this means that the rest of the team is always teasing him.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows very little about Peter, but what he does know, he doesn't like! Not only is he currently facing two counts of second degree sexual assault, he's racked up numerous restraining orders over the years.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Denver Dog discovers that recapturing the past can be more difficult then tracking down felons. On a day of more misses then hits in their fugitive hunting, Dog and Beth repeatedly collide with reminders of their early days.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Working for a bondswoman friend, Mary Ellen, Dog and his team hunt Chris, a fugitive wanted on drug charges. Dog turns over every rock, but to no avail.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog goes after Virginia, a hard-to-find lawbreaker. He gets a tip that a pickup truck will be going to Virginia's house. In true private-eye fashion.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog decides to sweep the island clean of as many fugitives as he can in two days. Raymond, wanted on drug charges, is an easy grab. Mauro, wanted for solicitation, is busted.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog believes that the family that plays together stays together. But what happens when a family's idea of fun is getting high and running amuck? Today's case is a twofer, a brother and sister both charged with drug related offenses.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Michael is out on bail for drug sales, theft, and violation of parole. Dog's after him for failing to appear in court and his only lead is Jen, his co-signer and girlfriend.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Baby Lyssa's wedding is only three days away, but Dog is thinking about bounties, not bouquets. A hot jump has comes in and Dog wants to go on the hunt.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the cameras are turned around.

programme.desc: After leaving a work party late at night, Ramona Krotinea's body gets discovered in the trunk of her own car the next day, and police need to reconstruct who and what happened in the intervening hours.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Ventura, California, a wife goes missing after a mysterious arrest; while in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, thousands of dollars stored in shoeboxes provide a vital clue to solve a murder.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Boone County, Iowa, a man on a farm believes that he's shot himself but can't figure out how; in Pryor, Oklahoma, an affair turns deadly, resulting in a house fire.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 3, 1990, a 14-year-old girl ran away from her mother's home and disappeared without a trace. Her mother hoped Pasadena, Texas police could find her before it was too late. Six months later, their worst fear was realized when a farmer discovered the young girl's remains in an Illinois barn. The FBI was called in to help. Agents tracked down a trucker who they believed was responsible for 50 more deaths. Investigators knew they had to stop this menace of the highways.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In September 1997, a team of masked gunmen robbed an armored car facility in Los Angeles, and made off with $18.9 million, the largest takeover heist in U.S. history. An employee believed she recognized the voice of one of the robbers, and FBI agents began conducting surveillance on a former employee of the facility. With only one piece of physical evidence, a fragment of a vehicle taillight, authorities hoped to connect him to the crime, and locate his accomplices.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June of 1992, masked bandits pulled off a daring mid-day bank robbery. It marked the beginning of a four-year crime wave that rocked Seattle. With each new robbery, the bandits perfected their craft, leaving behind no evidence and escaping with hundreds and thousands of dollars. As the robbers became increasingly violent, pressure mounted to end their reign. With few leads, the FBI forced their own luck. The effort put them face to face with an armed and desperate fugitive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1980's, a pair of serial bank robbers gained a reputation among law enforcement officials as formidable bandits. Using the same modus operandi, the two men took hostages and emptied bank vaults across the Midwest. After the criminals escaped from police custody, FBI agents familiar with the bandits believed that they would attempt a grand-scale heist. By conducting surveillance on known associates of the criminals, authorities tried to anticipate the next target.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1991, the Safe Streets Task Force, a joint FBI / Washington D.C. Metropolitan Police Department organization, begins conducting an investigation into the violent activities of a local gang called the K Street Crew. Gang members are suspected of involvement in several area homicides. The FBI approaches several witnesses, hoping to convince them to testify against the gang members. Seven potential witnesses are murdered during the course of the investigation.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1988, a wealthy Jackson, Mississippi woman disappeared from her home in broad daylight. Left behind was a mysterious ransom note listing twelve names and no specific instructions. The note, and a few drops of blood were the only clues to her fate. FBI and local police struggled to find answers in the cryptic message so they could find the kidnapper and retrieve the victim before her time ran out. Solving the crime required the keen insight of a criminal profiler and the perseverance of a family, local authorities, and the FBI.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June of 2000, two gunmen rob a Seattle, WA bank, and flee on foot as officers chase them. One of the gunmen is killed in a firefight with police, the other escapes after assaulting a family and using their home to hide. The family helps FBI agents identify the man, who is suspected of several other robberies. Seattle SWAT teams, working with the FBI, search the home of the assailant's mother, and find ammunition matching that used at the bank robbery.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1980s, the drug trade ravages Chicago's inner city neighborhoods and violent crime threatens to destroy entire communities. As drug profits grow, gangs rule the streets. One of the most dangerous is the El Rukns. FBI Agents team up with state and local police to bring them down, but in the process, uncover a bizarre and frightening terrorist plot.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In February of 1996, New Jersey millionaire Frank Black flew to Florida to close a major business deal before retiring. He never came home. Authorities in New Jersey sensed foul play and brought in the FBI. Agents learned of a mystery woman in Florida who was to meet Black. Phone records showed a flood of calls to Black from his business rival just before the disappearance.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In New York, the FBI and local police join forces to battle the constant influx of Colombian cocaine into the city's ports. One detective goes undercover, posing as a Mafia wise-guy, and infiltrates a drug gang connected to Pablo Escobar's Medellin cartel. The detective must be bold, but cautious, taking on the role of a tough-guy, but always aware that if the gang suspects anything, they won't hesitate to kill him.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1980's the New York City Police Department is fighting a losing battle in the war on drugs. Distributors and drug gangs in New York are making millions, and they will do anything to protect their profits. After two law enforcement officers are targeted, hundreds of police officers and FBI agents devise a bold plan to crackdown on the drug gangs and shut down their deadly business.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, a series of crimes in a small Iowa farming community left residents reeling in shock and fear. Two young men went on a crime spree of robbery, kidnapping and murder, and then disappeared. By the time they were identified, they already had a twelve-hour lead. As the hunt for the two men expanded, the FBI committed its resources to tracking down the suspects. The pursuit would take agents across six states to catch the killers before they struck again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In November of 1994, when a Wells Fargo armored van disappeared from a Glendale, Arizona mall, local authorities and the FBI scrambled to recover it, and its cargo of nearly a million dollars. Six hours later, agents found the van, its driver shot dead inside and the money gone. It was a perfect hit by professionals who left no clue behind. Months passed before a solid lead developed. In January, a tip led agents to look into a former prison guard.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1999, Police investigate two brutal murders in two small towns located hundreds of miles apart. The crimes seem random and unrelated, until investigators discover a terrifying link. Local police and the FBI must untangle a web of liesto stop a dangerous gang that will kill a man for his Identity.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: Tyler Hadley discusses how he, as a troubled 17-year-old, bludgeoned his mother and father to death with a hammer.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: Bo Pete Jeffrey claims no memory of the crime he's convicted for, the brutal beating and murder of his wife; four years into his life sentence, Jeffrey tells a different story that opens a new window into the mind of this convicted murderer.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Henderson, NV, a suburb of Las Vegas, two robbers brandishing assault rifles ambush armored guards as they exit their truck on March 3, 2000. The robbers kill both guards and seize $5,000. As the killers run to their getaway car, a police officer arrives and opens fire, striking one escaping assailant in the leg. After loosing the killers in a chase, police collect blood left by the injured robber and bullet casings from the firefight.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: Tyler Hadley discusses how he, as a troubled 17-year-old, bludgeoned his mother and father to death with a hammer.

programme.title: The FBI Files

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By April of 1995 in Washington, D.C., two officers had been shot and one had been murdered. Each had been sitting in their patrol cars when a man sneaked up and opened fire. The FBI was brought in to help catch the cop killer. Agents identified the man who was most likely the killer, but he was nowhere to be found. Months of surveillance operations around the country finally yielded a break; they found their suspect in Baltimore, MD.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to The Monticello Hotel in Longview, Washington, owned by Phillip Lovingfoss: a wealthy individual with a fleet of classic cars and a drinking problem so serious that it is threatening to destroy his hotel and his life.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits Applegate, Oregon, to try to rescue the failing Applegate River Lodge. Despite being over a million dollars in debt, the owner, Richard Davis, is more interested in smoking cannabis than he is in fixing the problems of this family-built inn.

programme.title: Addicted to Boob Jobs
programme.desc: Journalist Louise Roe investigates why women in the United Kingdom have plastic surgery on their breasts not just once, but multiple times.

programme.title: The Perfect Vagina
programme.desc: Lisa Rogers tries to find out why more and more women are considering vaginal surgery for either aesthetic or cultural reasons.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight, for the first time ever on Kitchen Nightmares, Gordon takes on a nightmare restaurant abroad. La Parra de Burriana is an ex-pat restaurant in Nerja on Spain's Costa del Sol. Nestling among the cafes lining the seafront offering all-day English breakfast and chips, La Parra is the brainchild of twenty-six-year-old ex-nightclub manager Laurence. He set himself up in business eighteen months ago with a loan from his dad and, although he's not an experienced chef, mans the kitchen on his own, determined to offer something better than chips to his largely British clientele.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's second programme Gordon tackles a pub for the first time, getting to grips with The Fenwick Arms in rural Lancashire. The pub is run by landlord Brian who, after thirty years in the business and a quadruple heart-bypass, still puts in 120 hours a week and insists on laying down the law in the kitchen. Despite their best endeavours Brian and his partner Elaine are ~250k in debt, losing ~1500 a week and facing bankruptcy within three months unless there's a drastic reversal in their fortunes.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's programme Gordon finds a chef caught in a time warp when he tackles a picturesque but largely unfrequented upmarket restaurant in King's Lynn, a traditional market town on the Norfolk coast. For the last eighteen months ex Michelin-starred chef Nick has owned and run Rococo but his past success is now eluding him. The menu is past its sell-by date, the service is stuffy, the food is over-priced and the only thing being fed is his ego. Yet, despite debts of ~100k and the prospect of putting his home at risk and his young family on the streets, Nick continues to cook comatose in a 1990s fantasy land of his own making.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's final programme of the series Gordon grapples with girl power when he takes on an intimate family-run restaurant in the heart of WAG territory near Liverpool. For the last three years Morgan's has been run by antiques dealer-turned-restaurateur SANDY and her two daughters HELEN and LAURA. The beautifully-designed dining room has a prime high street location and should be the perfect eatery for the trendy local clientele. But Head Chef Phil is grappling with an eclectic menu that includes mashed potato with apricots and his cooking's just not up to it.

programme.title: My Uncle Is the Green River Killer
programme.desc: After living with the stigma of being related to a serial killer, family members confront Gary Ridgeway in an effort to heal their emotional wounds and bring closure to the families of his victims.

programme.title: The Hunt for the Zodiac Killer
programme.desc: Investigators gain unprecedented access to files, unearthing a complicated cypher that may contain the killer's name as well as links between the Zodiac Killer and an unsolved case; a prime suspect with code training emerges.

programme.title: The Hunt for the Zodiac Killer
programme.desc: The team uncovers clues that the killer may have served in the U.S. Armed Forces, as the supercomputer identifies symbols in the code that would have been known to only a few when it was written; Sal and Ken find new evidence.

programme.title: The Hunt for the Zodiac Killer
programme.desc: The team uncovers a mysterious new cipher related to the Zodiac Killer, while the supercomputer uncovers a strange lunar pattern linking the killings; a taunting riddle by the killer may lead to a body; a second prime suspect emerges.

programme.title: The Hunt for the Zodiac Killer
programme.desc: The hunt goes into high gear as the FBI releases secret files on the killer; a handwriting analyst connects the Zodiac's letters to a taunting letter mailed 3,000 miles away in Albany, N.Y.; the code team has a massive breakthrough on the Z-340.

programme.title: The Hunt for the Zodiac Killer
programme.desc: Sal and Ken investigate San Francisco, the epicenter of the Zodiac Killer murders; the Code Team announces a team member has solved the Zodiac's infamous Z340 code, which has eluded codebreakers for 50 years.

programme.desc: Strange rock carvings from 8,000 B.C.; unexplained sightings in the new world; a frightening anomaly plaguing the American west; a strange man-made cave filled with ancient objects and mummies; strange lights and unexplained weather anomalies.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Stories of emperors, kings and pharaohs consulting a pantheon of nine gods are found in many cultures lending credence to the theory that there is an intergalactic council of nine working behind the scenes to monitor and guide humanity.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Over 10,000 crop circles, appearing in 50 different countries, have been reported; examining whether they are all part of an elaborate hoax or not.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: For centuries, humanity has looked up at the Moon with a sense of wonder. But is the Moon just a rock floating in space? Or could it hold profound secrets?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Millions of people around the world claim to have had an encounter with a creature unlike any recognized by mainstream science.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Throughout human history, many cultures have used sacred rituals to express their spiritual beliefs; there are many rituals that are thought to unlock supernatural powers.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: All over the world are forbidden "triangles" that are mysterious regions where ships, planes and people enter and then just disappear; they are found in Bermuda, Alaska, Japan and elsewhere.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Examining if modern technology and scientific knowledge can help protect people from almost anything, including natural disasters, or if vulnerability remains a factor.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: During the Middle Ages, the Vikings were infamous for being a bloodthirsty band of seafaring warriors; historians are learning surprising new things about this Norse society.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Whether the ancients had scientific knowledge lost to time; how and why they fashioned remarkable feats of engineering.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: UFOs sightings are more common among police offices than you might believe and many have witnessed things they can't explain.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Six "doughnut-shaped aircraft" were spotted off the coast of Maury Island, WA one week before the reported UFO crash in Roswell, NM. Harold Dahl and his son witnessed the aircraft dancing in unknown form and one spewing white-hot fragments over the water.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: In 1956, an object was detected over the North Sea heading toward Bentwaters RAF base--a base with nuclear weapons. Two Venom fighters made contact with the object, but their weapons and electrical systems were rendered useless.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Reverse engineering is a common practice used by private industry and the government as a means to keep up with or surpass the competition. Has the US military derived various forms of technology, including stealth technology, from downed UFO's?

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: For years, people have claimed to have had direct, personal contact with an alien. In this episode of our series, the team tracks down several people who claim to have had such contact.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: On January 28, 1994, an Air France pilot, his crew and passengers witnessed a brightly-glowing red and brown disc-shaped object while flying to London.

programme.title: UFO Hunters

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: Weaving together the stories of five of America's most notorious serial killers - Ted Bundy, John Wayne Gacy, Jeffrey Dahmer, the Green River Killer and BTK.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: In the mid-to-late 1970s, Bundy, Gacy and BTK begin claiming victims, while Dahmer and the Green River Killer inch ever closer to realizing their grim fantasies.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: With their confidence growing in 1978, Bundy, Gacy, Dahmer, the Green River Killer, and BTK continue their game of cat and mouse with law enforcement; Gacy and Bundy are finally brought to justice; Dahmer struggles to resist his murderous urges.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: After years of evading capture, Gacy and Bundy are finally brought to justice as they both face punishment for their heinous crimes.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: Two of The Five, Gacy and Bundy, sit on death row in the mid-1980s as their murderous rampages are curtailed.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: After years of public fear at the hands of "The Five," the remaining three killers are captured between 1991-2005.

programme.desc: Sixteen-year-old Aaron Campbell didn't admit his horrific crimes until after his conviction; in the dead of night, he abducted six-year-old neighbor Alesha MacPhail and carried her to a nearby wood, where he raped and murdered her.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1980's, a pair of serial bank robbers gained a reputation among law enforcement officials as formidable bandits. Using the same modus operandi, the two men took hostages and emptied bank vaults across the Midwest. After the criminals escaped from police custody, FBI agents familiar with the bandits believed that they would attempt a grand-scale heist. By conducting surveillance on known associates of the criminals, authorities tried to anticipate the next target.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1988, a wealthy Jackson, Mississippi woman disappeared from her home in broad daylight. Left behind was a mysterious ransom note listing twelve names and no specific instructions. The note, and a few drops of blood were the only clues to her fate. FBI and local police struggled to find answers in the cryptic message so they could find the kidnapper and retrieve the victim before her time ran out. Solving the crime required the keen insight of a criminal profiler and the perseverance of a family, local authorities, and the FBI.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1988, new light was shed on the mysterious death of a South Carolina farmer when a criminal confessed that two prominent community members hired him to commit murder. Local police and FBI agents arrested a wealthy businessman and later learned that, even behind bars, he commanded the power to corrupt and kill. Using prison informants, agents had to prevent him from murdering again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In February 1988, a record store clerk in Sandusky, Ohio, was fatally shot in his van. After discovering a night deposit bag with thousands of dollars in the vehicle, police knew that robbery was not the motive, and began to investigate other possibilities. FBI agents learned that several motorcycle gang members had been stopped nearby on a traffic violation shortly after the murder and theorized that the clerk's murder may have been a botched hit carried out by a gang member.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A California bank manager panics and calls in the FBI after the door to his vault refuses to open. Upon inspection, the vault has been blasted into from the ceiling, and over $2 million in valuables is gone. When agents find no clues as to the robbers or their whereabouts in California, they send details of the crime to other FBI field offices. It is not long before agents in Ohio are investigating a bank vault robbery that is strikingly similar to the California heist.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In August 1992, a man returned to his Memphis home and discovered that his wife was missing. The husband, as well as his friends, family and neighbors began to receive ransom calls. FBI agents noticed that one neighbor seemed to have the best rapport with the kidnapper. They began to question his level of involvement, but had to proceed carefully, knowing that he could be their only link to the missing woman.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1980, extortionists plant a thousand pound bomb in a Nevada casino and demand millions of dollars, or they will detonate the device. The bomb is the largest explosive device the FBI has ever seen. Detonation would be a disaster. Agents and bomb experts must disarm the deadly device, and stop the dangerous extortionist who built it.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: An Arkansas State Trooper is shot and killed after pulling over a van for a traffic violation. Officers apprehend the shooter, after a car chase and shootout. ATF is alerted when officers find weapons and explosives in the man's vehicle. Further testing of the weapons reveals one was used in a murder several months earlier. ATF traces some of the firearms to purchases made by another man from and arms dealer. They also match silencer marks from the weapons to a third man previously arrested for stealing a flatbed truck.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1990 and 1991, Chicago police and the FBI were on the trail of a bank robber whose holdups were becoming increasingly violent. The criminal consistently used stolen Japanese cars to carry out the robberies, so authorities hoped to identify him by tracking vehicle thefts. When they finally located the man known as the bearded bandit, they learned that he did not work alone and he had made a pact never to surrender.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1988, a wealthy Jackson, Mississippi woman disappeared from her home in broad daylight. Left behind was a mysterious ransom note listing twelve names and no specific instructions. The note, and a few drops of blood were the only clues to her fate. FBI and local police struggled to find answers in the cryptic message so they could find the kidnapper and retrieve the victim before her time ran out. Solving the crime required the keen insight of a criminal profiler and the perseverance of a family, local authorities, and the FBI.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Henderson, NV, a suburb of Las Vegas, two robbers brandishing assault rifles ambush armored guards as they exit their truck on March 3, 2000. The robbers kill both guards and seize $5,000. As the killers run to their getaway car, a police officer arrives and opens fire, striking one escaping assailant in the leg. After loosing the killers in a chase, police collect blood left by the injured robber and bullet casings from the firefight.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the mid-1990's, a gang of professional bank robbers raided cities across seven states. Disguises and speed protected their identity from cameras and the police as they stole hundreds of thousands of dollars, always leaving a bomb to terrorize their victims. The stakes were raised when the FBI discovered the robbers had an agenda beyond their personal wealth. To stop these extremists and their growing operation, the FBI needed to capture their leaders.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, a series of crimes in a small Iowa farming community left residents reeling in shock and fear. Two young men went on a crime spree of robbery, kidnapping and murder, and then disappeared. By the time they were identified, they already had a twelve-hour lead. As the hunt for the two men expanded, the FBI committed its resources to tracking down the suspects. The pursuit would take agents across six states to catch the killers before they struck again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1980s, the drug trade ravages Chicago's inner city neighborhoods and violent crime threatens to destroy entire communities. As drug profits grow, gangs rule the streets. One of the most dangerous is the El Rukns. FBI Agents team up with state and local police to bring them down, but in the process, uncover a bizarre and frightening terrorist plot.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At 9:30 am on the morning of January 30, 1997, Richmond, VA police respond to a report of shots fired at a local bank. Two masked men brandishing automatic weapons confront, and open fire on officers responding to the call. The gunmen exit the bank, and retreat on foot, eventually eluding the officers. The FBI soon responds, only to find one bank teller dead, another wounded, and the bank's security guard shot four times, yet still alive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1980's, a pair of serial bank robbers gained a reputation among law enforcement officials as formidable bandits. Using the same modus operandi, the two men took hostages and emptied bank vaults across the Midwest. After the criminals escaped from police custody, FBI agents familiar with the bandits believed that they would attempt a grand-scale heist. By conducting surveillance on known associates of the criminals, authorities tried to anticipate the next target.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Alabama, a pair of convicted felons escaped the custody of a local deputy and fled across the country. Eluding authorities, they moved from state to state in a wave of abduction and car theft. When a foreign military officer disappeared along their trail, police and FBI agents wondered if the armed fugitives had become killers. Agents believed the pair were growing more violent and raced to find the escapees before more victims crossed their path.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: After a career criminal committed a vehicular homicide in New Orleans, FBI agents tracked him through his habits and addictions. They focused their investigation on gambling communities throughout the country and, when he resurfaced in Atlantic City, authorities used all of their resources to trap an elusive sociopath who claimed that he would never be taken alive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Georgia, a series of bizarre shootings terrorizes the town of East Point. Two people are killed, and two are critically wounded. At first the shootings seem targeted, then they seem random. As the body count climbs, the killer taunts law enforcement with mysterious notes. Agents believe the shooter will continue until he is deador behind bars.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Kokomo, Indiana an unthinkable crime terrified residents. A young woman was snatched from her home on a bright spring morning. Drops of blood and a torn window screen were all that was left to tell authorities what happened to the twenty-one year old victim. After several days of searching, a former FBI profiler narrowed the suspect list to one. Agents and detectives followed the trail across state lines hoping to find the victim before her time ran out.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In August 1984, the son of a successful real estate developer was kidnapped in front of his father's business in Miami. After the father received a $3 million ransom demand from a self-proclaimed terrorist, the FBI became involved. Based on witness descriptions of the car used in the kidnapping, authorities began to suspect a pair of Colombian nationals with a known grudge against the developer's family.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, violent militants are intent on turning the US Commonwealth into a communist dictatorship. They murder a policeman, turns their guns on a busload of unarmed Navy workers, and even launch an attack on the FBI. These ruthless killers have vowed to fight to the death. The FBI must use every tactic at their disposal to track down the terrorists and bring them to justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Lincoln County, Nebraska, a fugitive drug dealer engaged in a shootout with state troopers, wounding two of them, and eluded capture after a high-speed chase. Authorities immediately set up a statewide manhunt, connecting the fugitive to a murder in western Nebraska. A chance sighting led FBI agents to a second confrontation with the killer, who was more determined than ever to escape the law.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, a gang based in the U.S. Virgin Islands began smuggling thousands of kilos of cocaine into mainland America. Police and federal agents target the gang, but its leader remains a mystery. In an investigation spanning from Georgia to South America, local police, the DEA, U.S. Customs and the FBI work together to take down this dangerous drug gang.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On December 21, 1998, two gunmen kidnap three janitors on their way to clean the Bank of America ATM repository in Las Vegas. The gunmen force the janitors to let them in the ATM repository and hold them hostage until the armored car guards arrive to make their nightly collection. When the guards enter the bank, the gunmen surprise them and shoot one guard in the chest before escaping with $1,088,000, the largest bank robbery take in Las Vegas history.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In October 1993, a robber surprised unsuspecting customers by dropping through the roof of a California bank. When police arrived, he escaped from the roof in a hail of bullets. A tip from a local resident led police and FBI agents to the perpetrator. They would soon learn that he had masterminded a local kidnapping, and held the fate of an innocent woman in his hands.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Henderson, NV, a suburb of Las Vegas, two robbers brandishing assault rifles ambush armored guards as they exit their truck on March 3, 2000. The robbers kill both guards and seize $5,000. As the killers run to their getaway car, a police officer arrives and opens fire, striking one escaping assailant in the leg. After loosing the killers in a chase, police collect blood left by the injured robber and bullet casings from the firefight.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1988, a wealthy Jackson, Mississippi woman disappeared from her home in broad daylight. Left behind was a mysterious ransom note listing twelve names and no specific instructions. The note, and a few drops of blood were the only clues to her fate. FBI and local police struggled to find answers in the cryptic message so they could find the kidnapper and retrieve the victim before her time ran out. Solving the crime required the keen insight of a criminal profiler and the perseverance of a family, local authorities, and the FBI.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1980's the New York City Police Department is fighting a losing battle in the war on drugs. Distributors and drug gangs in New York are making millions, and they will do anything to protect their profits. After two law enforcement officers are targeted, hundreds of police officers and FBI agents devise a bold plan to crackdown on the drug gangs and shut down their deadly business.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Arizona, a shipment of money vanished into the high desert, along with the two men hired to guard it. The FBI didn't know if the guards were participants or victims of an ambush. Answers lay somewhere in the thousands of square miles of Arizona's northwest territory. When the vehicle was recovered with three hundred thousand dollars and the drivers missing, suspicions that the crime was an inside job grew.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In January 1984, a U.S. Customs official disappears from his post near the Del Rio, Texas border crossing, prompting local police to search for four Latin American suspects driving a Pontiac Grand Prix. The following day, the Customs official was found dead. Two state troopers recovered the missing officer's service revolver after a fatal altercation with two men. Local police and the FBI continued searching for the suspect vehicle, prepared for a confrontation with desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Memphis, Tennessee, a horrible crime terrified local residents. When a wealthy young mother was abducted in front of her in-laws' home, the police had no shortage of suspects. The twenty-five year old victim left behind a tumultuous marriage, an ex-husband, and several spurned boyfriends. All were on the FBI's short list. To find the woman and her abductor, investigators would have to first determine the motive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In July 1997, a triple murder terrified residents in the nation's capital. In a Georgetown coffee shop, three employees were shot to death. Investigators could find no immediate suspects and no clear motive for the attack. Evidence at the crime scene pointed in many different directions. Was this a hate crime, a robbery gone wrong, or an act of cold-blooded vengeance against one of the victims?

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1991, the Safe Streets Task Force, a joint FBI / Washington D.C. Metropolitan Police Department organization, begins conducting an investigation into the violent activities of a local gang called the K Street Crew. Gang members are suspected of involvement in several area homicides. The FBI approaches several witnesses, hoping to convince them to testify against the gang members. Seven potential witnesses are murdered during the course of the investigation.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the Spring of 1997, a killer preying on senior citizens terrorizes the River Parish area of Southern Louisiana. By May, local police and the New Orleans FBI are exploring a connection between the April 9 murder of a 71-year old widow and the May 9 murder of a retired couple. A month later, authorities forward information on the crimes to the FBI's Behavioral Science Unit in Quantico, VA, hoping a profile will help them narrow the field of possible suspects.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A man is found suffocated in his Pennsylvania home, his checkbook, credit cards and vehicle appear to have been stolen. Fingerprints from the victim identify a recent escapee from a minimum-security prison, as well as his girlfriend. Investigators flag the dead man's credit cards, and are alerted when one is used in North Dakota. The FBI is called in and joins another task force already assembled because of a suspected kidnapping.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Lincoln County, Nebraska, a fugitive drug dealer engaged in a shootout with state troopers, wounding two of them, and eluded capture after a high-speed chase. Authorities immediately set up a statewide manhunt, connecting the fugitive to a murder in western Nebraska. A chance sighting led FBI agents to a second confrontation with the killer, who was more determined than ever to escape the law.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, the death of a government witness, and the suspicious circumstances surrounding it, lead the FBI and local authorities to suspect corruption in the highest levels of the police force. With the help of a cooperating witness, investigators find the scope of the corruption is far greater that they first thought. Authorities struggle to capture the rouge officers, men who once swore to uphold the law, but now use their power to commit heinous crimes.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In September 1997, a team of masked gunmen robbed an armored car facility in Los Angeles, and made off with $18.9 million, the largest takeover heist in U.S. history. An employee believed she recognized the voice of one of the robbers, and FBI agents began conducting surveillance on a former employee of the facility. With only one piece of physical evidence, a fragment of a vehicle taillight, authorities hoped to connect him to the crime, and locate his accomplices.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the southwest one serial bank robber claimed his loot went to the poor, but this thief was no folk hero. He had a gun and was willing to shoot. The gunman was desperate to stay free, a threat to anyone in his way. The FBI and U.S. marshals teamed up to capture a resourceful criminal who proved he would never stop fighting.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In August 1992, a man returned to his Memphis home and discovered that his wife was missing. The husband, as well as his friends, family and neighbors began to receive ransom calls. FBI agents noticed that one neighbor seemed to have the best rapport with the kidnapper. They began to question his level of involvement, but had to proceed carefully, knowing that he could be their only link to the missing woman.

programme.title: Making a Serial Killer
programme.desc: A routine traffic stop would reveal the secret depths of Stewart Weldon's criminal ways.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: A jailing for the shocking murder of author Helen Bailey leads to a second conviction of another.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: A master manipulator is accused of the murder of his wife, and is eventually caught out by a polygraph test - and his own fiance.

programme.desc: Dublin man Eric Locke refuses to accept it when Sonia Blount, a mother of one, ends their relationship.

programme.desc: Recordings provide vital evidence to solve the death of a man's wife, and a feud leads to a fatal house fire.

programme.desc: Jane Longhurst vanishes after making a plan to go swimming with her friend's boyfriend.

programme.desc: In March 2005, the garda recover human body parts from the Royal Canal in Dublin.

programme.desc: The Alaska serial killer Robert Hansen who murdered at least seventeen women during a spree that lasted for more than a decade.

programme.desc: A fugitive from the United States murders one British police officer and tries to kill two more, sparking a nationwide search.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: Melanie and David Clarks marriage was volatile, passionate, sometimes abusive. It ended when one of them snapped and picked up a knife.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: Micah Rine was a good Christian girl, and she thought husband Thomas Pate was equally devoted to God. In fact, nothing could be further from the truth.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: Lois Riess was a gambling addict who would do anything to feed her habit. Even go on a killing and robbing spree across America.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: A politician meets her future husband in the hospital as she mourns her previous husbands life. What she doesnt know is he wants to get her out of the picture.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G. has just graduated from medical school and is set to begin her first job as an M.E. in Jacksonville, Florida when a high-profile case challenges her to use her newly acquired skills.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 94-year-old woman dies in the hospital after having a convulsion. The case becomes the business of the medical examiner's office when no one will sign her death certificate.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's an early Sunday morning when a local resident decides to take a short-cut through the church parking lot. Walking past a lone car, the resident can't believe his eyes.

programme.title: Killer in Plain Sight
programme.desc: Soon-to-be mother Cindy Thompson is brutally murdered in a horrifying night-time attack.

programme.title: Killer in Plain Sight
programme.desc: High school student Shauna Marie Card is found stabbed to death in a violent, angry attack in her home.

programme.title: Killer in Plain Sight
programme.desc: When thirty-eight year-old Robert Limon is shot while working in a remote train yard, video surveillance reveals both a limping man and a motorcycle heading to the crime scene.

programme.title: Killer in Plain Sight
programme.desc: Sue Snow takes some pills in the morning and dies suddenly from cyanide poisoning.

programme.title: Killer in Plain Sight
programme.desc: Traveling jewelry salesman Jay Orbin's dismembered body is found on the edge of Phoenix.

programme.title: Killer in Plain Sight
programme.desc: When Susan Smith disappears without a trace, police just assume she has just taken off again.

programme.title: Killer in Plain Sight

programme.desc: A boy is found dead after a trip to Disneyland, and a parking dispute escalates into a double murder.

programme.title: Killers: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A camera hidden in a bag of chocolates solves a murder, and a gloating social media post entraps a killer.

programme.desc: The notorious story of a man convicted of the murder of two young girls, as well as another killing at a military base.

programme.desc: The shocking story of the two men who murder a millionaire and three generations of his family in a vicious, greed-fueled attack.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Police in Aurora, Colorado find the body of a young man in his own home with a bullet wound to the head.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: William Bonin is known to some as the 'Freeway Killer,' thought to have raped, tortured and murdered a minimum of twenty-one boys and young men before he was executed in 1996.

programme.desc: A killer attacks his ex-girlfriend in a jealous frenzy and commits a brutal murder after a campaign of harassment.

programme.desc: Nick ventures into the Brushy Mountain Penitentiary and the Madison Seminary to communicate with ghosts.

programme.title: Death Walker With Nick Groff
programme.desc: The owners of the Willis House Inn in Michigan call Nick to see if their inn is safe to open.

programme.title: Death Walker With Nick Groff
programme.desc: Nick visits the Octagon Hall, a property built by a secret society known as the Freemasons.

programme.title: Death Walker With Nick Groff
programme.desc: Nick visits the Sallie House and taunts the entity known as Sallie to capture her on camera.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An employee is found dead in a restaurant kitchen. Clues found near the body include an empty cash register, a knife and a trail of blood splotches leading to a vandalized car in the parking lot.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: After a brief illness, 34-year old Claire Jackson dies suddenly in the hospital from massive liver failure and winds up in Dr. G's morgue.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: A seven-year-old girl is kidnapped and raped, but it takes almost 20 years for her assailant to be caught.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: When an unknown woman commits suicide in a cemetery in 1996, the mystery of who she is lasts for decades.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives

programme.title: Murdered at First Sight
programme.desc: 11-year-old Jeralee leaves home on her local newspaper route. It's dusk when her parents become worried.

programme.title: Murdered at First Sight
programme.desc: Robin Chard is making his way home from a night out when his life is cut short by two complete strangers.

programme.title: Murdered at First Sight
programme.desc: While walking her dogs, Debbie Buxton crosses paths with the man who ends her life.

programme.title: Making a Serial Killer
programme.desc: The so-called Leaf Killer led police on a manhunt after brutally killing an entire family.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: The investigation into the death of Spokane, Wash., businessman exposes a web of malevolence extending from the Pacific Northwest to a North Dakota oil field.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: After a 15-year-old girl disappears, investigators discover a creek where the local teenagers hang out that may hold the answer to her disappearance.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: After being severely beaten in her own home, a high school girl goes under hypnosis to try to identify her attacker.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: Josh Mankiewicz reports on the mysterious disappearance of a Colorado rancher, whose friends think something isn't right and spend years fighting for answers.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: Two tenacious sisters determined to fulfill a promise investigate the mystery surrounding their mother's death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An examination of the first time animal DNA was used to solve a criminal case. When the body of Douglas Beamish's estranged wife Shirley Duguay was discovered, authorities linked 20 cat hairs found on her jacket to a cat owned by Beamish's parents.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teenager went missing after an evening of horseback riding. Her body was found a month later, three miles from her home. The killer unknowingly left trace evidence behind _ tiny but unmistakable clues which pointed to him and him alone.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is killed while walking her dogs in the woods. Since she had no enemies and her husband has an alibi, police assume it was a hunting accident...until a strange letter turns up allegedly written by the woman before her death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1988, the body of a young woman was discovered in an Ohio river. Most of the evidence had been washed away, but the victim's 6 year-old son unwittingly told investigators all they needed to know...without saying a word. The clue was in his genes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: California police had several suspects in the robbery and brutal murder of an elderly couple. Ten years later, a determined forensic scientist used material from a dentist's office to uncover ballistic evidence which had been overlooked.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of 9-year-old Jessica Knott is investigated. Investigators use a garbage bag to connect suspect James Edward Crow, Jr. to the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three homicides on two continents looked like professional executions. Investigators on both sides of the Atlantic needed to find out if they were related and, if they were, who or what they had in common.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three seemingly unrelated deaths proved to be serial murders. The killer had been careful _ he used poison which had no taste or odor. Fortunately for investigators, it also had a unique chemical signature.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation into the murder of Katie Poirier is stymied by the lack of a body, but they find a few charred remains including a tooth. The tooth's filling contains unique properties that help investigators identify her remains. Further forensic evidence is then used to convict Donald Blom of her murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Firefighters found an entire family dead inside their home, it seemed like a murder-suicide. But there were several inconsistent clues in the rubble. Could ballistics, a time card, and some secret audiotapes unravel the mystery?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A drive-by shooting leaves one man dead and another seriously wounded. Cell phone calls and shell casings point to a suspect, but authorities are unable to place him at the crime scene. A forensic geologist proves that dirt is anything but dumb.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The decomposed body of a young woman was discovered in a Bakersfield irrigation canal. If there was trace evidence, it had been washed away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is found dead in a ravine, but crucial crime scene evidence had been washed away by severe thunderstorms. Twice, the trail turned cold. Almost 20 years later, an old hat and a chip of stainless steel brought the killer to justice.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Genell Plude is found dead in her bathroom, the scene points to suicide. But a coroner's inquest and a unique application of forensic science gave investigators a different explanation for her death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man disappears one year to the day after beginning an affair with his friend's wife. 15 years later, with the help of a metal detector, police found evidence which would prove what had happened, and who was responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A patrol officer is shocked by the amount of blood at a traffic accident and is shocked by the coroner's ruling until an anonymous phone call re-ignites the case.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In Pennsylvania 1984, a passer-by finds the torso of a woman in a cardboard box. Investigators rely on insect activity analysis by a forensic entomologist to determine when the murder victim was killed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of Philadelphia college athlete Aimee Willard is investigated after her car was found on the roadside. When her body is found, the police find unusual marks on her body and DNA evidence that eventually lead to her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman's death in Pennsylvania triggers a homicide investigation into another woman's death in North Carolina. The similarities in the cases were striking, and examiners must determine if the suspect's story about accidental drowning is all wet.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Using an anonymous letter and geographical profiling, investigators close in on a serial rapist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1988, the body of a young woman was discovered in an Ohio river. Most of the evidence had been washed away, but the victim's 6 year-old son unwittingly told investigators all they needed to know...without saying a word. The clue was in his genes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is killed while walking her dogs in the woods. Since she had no enemies and her husband has an alibi, police assume it was a hunting accident...until a strange letter turns up allegedly written by the woman before her death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A neighbor watched as a man stabbed his wife, pushed her into the swimming pool and held her head under water. The husband, however, had no recollection of the crime. A jury would have to decide between evidence and the mysteries of the mind.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: California police had several suspects in the robbery and brutal murder of an elderly couple. Ten years later, a determined forensic scientist used material from a dentist's office to uncover ballistic evidence which had been overlooked.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The sensitive nose of a forensic examiner sniffs out murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police were puzzled by an obscure print found at a crime scene where one man had been killed and two teenage girls were seriously injured. Neither of the girls could identify their attacker. But one simple clue helped track the footsteps of a killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bombings are difficult to solve, because the perpetrator isn't usually at the scene, and the evidence goes up in smoke. In this case pieces of plastic the size of grains of sand hold the key to a man's murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman was found dead on a golf course in the Bahamas. The grass on that course was so distinctive, it had evidentiary value. The evidence led police to two suspects. Each blamed the other, and they had to find out who the killer was.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A union official is executed in his home not long after a strike by the union membership. Neither his wife nor anyone in the neighborhood heard any gunshots. It would take a forensic sound test, an electron microscope, and a nightgown to explain why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into a brutal attack on two boys near a pond relies on evidence fished out of the murky water. It was the first case where Diatom evidence was used to place a suspect at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mother of two vanishes after a shopping trip. Her body is discovered a month later. Witnesses say they saw the victim being forced into a car by an unknown person.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two sets of scientists probe a woman's death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1993, the state of Florida was known for more than just Disney World. Worldwide attention focused on a rash of robberies which targeted tourists. Some vacationers were killed in these attacks, but some fought and survived, despite severe injuries.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 29-year-old woman was killed instantly when a bomb exploded in her home. The device was so powerful that shrapnel was embedded in houses across the street. The bomber had not only knowledge and skill, but also a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, when the wife of a serviceman was brutally murdered in the Philippines, investigators had to reassemble a 5-1/4 inch computer disk which had been cut to pieces with pinking shears in order to find the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Hikers near Anchorage, Alaska discovered a body wrapped in sheets which were edged in orange stitching. Clinging to the sheet, they also discovered a tuft of red carpet fibers _ threads of evidence which led them straight to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: No one in a quiet residential community saw anything unusual the day one of their neighbors was brutally attacked and murdered. Fingerprints found at the crime scene and surveillance video helped investigators to apprehend the presumed killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of 16-year-old Leanne Tiernan was discovered nine months after she disappeared. Forensic scientists found clues that painted a virtual portrait of her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the kidnapping and rape of an 18-year-old Ohio woman is aided when the victim returns hours after the incident occurred. With her help, the police are able to track the assailant Craig Bailey to his front door.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Authorities track a kidnapper who allowed his victim, 17-year-old Shari Smith, to write a last will and testament on a note pad, then informed the family of her murder, as well as the later murder of a 10-year-old Debra May Helmick. A phone number written on a previous page left a lasting impression, which helped to convict Larry Gene Bell.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1987 disappearance of Houston resident Tracy Jo Shine is recalled. The investigation went cold until 2000 when a 'cold case squad' learned that the woman's ex-boyfriend Michael Neal had bragged about killing her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A talented television news anchor was shot to death outside her home; it appeared to be a crime of passion, perpetrated by an obsessed fan.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For years, a woman suffered from what appeared to be the unpleasant side effects of lithium, a drug prescribed to treat bipolar disorder. When she died, investigators had to determine if her death was due to natural causes, suicide, or murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A healthy young man dies mysteriously in his sleep, and toxicology tests reveal a lethal dose of lidocaine in his blood. Investigators find a suicide note, and presume he killed himself until a forensic linguist examines the note.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mysterious computer crash pushed a thriving manufacturing company to the brink of collapse, jeopardizing hundreds of employees' jobs. Forensic investigators must determine if the crash was the result of a computer defect, human error, or sabotage.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A high school gym teacher mysteriously left town, without saying goodbye to anyone. He later sent letters to explain why. But a closer forensic look at those letters, and a microscopic piece of tissue, gave investigators an entirely different explanation for where he went and why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Just weeks before a witness is to testify against the man accused of sexually assaulting her, she is murdered in the front yard of her own home. Investigators immediately suspect her attacker, but they don't have enough evidence to prove his guilt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How scientists solved a 1992 murder case involving cremation. It takes a long time and a very hot fire to cremate a human body, and thus destroy evidence of foul play. But the coroner who performed the autopsy on the body found telltale clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Computers aid the police and FBI in solving a string of crimes in St. Louis.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: At a murder scene, investigators find a shoe-print, several foreign hairs, and unknown fingerprints. But they believe the most telling piece of evidence is the bite mark on the victim's chest.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of a young woman was found under an isolated ramp of the Interstate, and a tiny, unique fiber on the victim's clothing led San Diego police straight to the most unlikely of killers.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Time of death becomes pivotal after a pregnant woman is found murdered in her air-conditioned bedroom. A striking similarity between her death and an HBO movie gives examiners the clues they need to thaw out the alibi of a cold-blooded killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young couple decided to celebrate their first wedding anniversary with a camping trip to Mount Hood. During the trip, the husband was shot and killed, and his wife told two different versions of the events which led to his death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Exploring how an American hit single from 1966 -- "The Cheater" by Bob Kuban and the In-Men -- foreshadowed the demise of the group's lead singer, Walter Scott.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1984, California firefighters had battled ten arson fires in three weeks. When cigarettes and a scrap of paper connected the southern California fires to several fires further north, the hunt was on for a dangerous pyromaniac.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an 11-year-old girl disappeared from a small town in a remote area of Alaska, investigators wondered if she'd been attacked by a bear or become lost in the dense woods. It turned out neither was true.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police officer accused of killing his estranged wife insists she committed suicide. Investigators say it was murder_ that it was physically impossible for the woman to have shot herself.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1988, the body of a young woman was discovered in an Ohio river. Most of the evidence had been washed away, but the victim's 6 year-old son unwittingly told investigators all they needed to know...without saying a word. The clue was in his genes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A look back at the case of the River Park Rapist, who assaulted four women in South Bend, Ind., during 1996. Law enforcement officers arrested Richard Alexander, who was convicted in 1998 and sentenced to 70 years in prison.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: With no forensic evidence inside a murder scene, investigators were baffled. But they suspected that the victim's dog had witnessed the crime. If she had, forensic scientists would have to find a way to find out what the dog had seen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An examination of the 2002 DC area shooting spree that resulted in ten murders.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a popular disc jockey was found murdered in a community garden, police swung into action. A sniffer dog and a blood spatter expert led police to the killer and he'd been much closer than they realized.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man died in his home after a long history of heart disease. It was assumed that this was the cause of his death. A few weeks after the funeral, rumors surfaced that the death was no accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two different men called police to report the same murder. Apparently, neither one knew that the other had called. The investigation uncovered even more unusual circumstances.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The news of a flight attendant's brutal murder prompted the son of a victim who had been killed five years earlier to contact police. Both murders had similar MOs, and analysis of biological evidence proved that these were serial killings.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Investigators sift through the ashes of a fire which killed a 40-year-old woman. The fire appeared to have been started by an unattended cigarette. On closer look, forensic scientists discover the cause was far more complicated.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Using an anonymous letter and geographical profiling, investigators close in on a serial rapist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young TV news producer is raped and murdered in her apartment. Police identify two suspects, but both are cleared of any wrongdoing. The case stalls for more than a year, and then investigators turn to the Commonwealth of Virginia's DNA Databank.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An unusual case involving the 1988 rape and murder of Nancy DePriest. After Chris Ochoa confessed, the case was closed. 8 years later, Achim Marino confessed to the same crime. DNA evidence cleared Ochoa while proving that Marino was the perpetrator.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A talented television news anchor was shot to death outside her home; it appeared to be a crime of passion, perpetrated by an obsessed fan.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man is found dead in his home, and his ex-wife has a perfect alibi. To determine time of death, investigators need to know when the victim ate his last meal. An endocrinologist, a forensic botanist, and a short-order cook answer their question.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an elderly couple died in a suspicious house fire, their son became the prime suspect. Investigators turned to forensic science to determine if the fire had been set deliberately, or if it was an unfortunate accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.desc: Forensics hopes to determine if this was revenge when the home of a state's witness is bombed, killing his father.

programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.desc: A teen was killed by her parents in what they said was self-defense, but forensic evidence told otherwise.

programme.title: Sins of the City

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: Nikki McPhatter had just begun a torrid romance with a man she met online. But Nikkis love life took a horrifying turn when she suddenly went missing. The search for the truth would uncover a conspiracy of deception and revenge. And expose a deadly monster hidden in plain sight.

programme.title: Deceived
programme.desc: Tammi McCreary thought she had met the man of her dreams in Eric Perteet. A charismatic and ambitious doctor from Chicago, Eric quickly swept Tammi off her feet. But Eric was not what he seemed to be. Shortly after their wedding, Tammi's new husband is arrested at the local hospital, and she is faced with a string of shocking lies and the knowledge that she is not the only woman who has fallen prey to Eric's deceitful ways.

programme.title: Thou Shalt Not
programme.desc: The Carr Brothers are troubled from a young age but nothing will compare to the harm they will inflict on the city of Wichita, KS. Then, Cory Cotham is no stranger to the law and holds little sacred, so when the promise of wealth has him crossing the line, theres no telling how far he will go.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: Troubled housewife Carolyn King deserts her family in search of a clean slate, only to find her perfect match in a local convict Bradley Martin. Next, teen mom Angel Glenn risks it all to support her baby. But when she crosses paths with a bad boy, Angel leaves her world of seduction for a life of crime.

programme.title: #Murder
programme.desc: 14-year-old Shaniesha Forbes, was your typical American teenager. If she wasnt hanging out with family or friends, she was busy scrolling through facebook, planning her next event on her busy social calendar. But when Shaniesha failed to come home from school or answer her phone in January of 2013, her mother knew something was terribly wrong. The search for the truth would expose the dark side of social media.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: In Las Vegas, when a legendary boxer is found dead by an alleged overdose despite no needles or syringes found at the scene, friends and family are immediately suspicious, and theories of his death quickly spread.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: Invoking Floridas controversial Stand Your Ground law, Cynthia Anderson guns down an intruder when she finds him trying to break into her home. But when the intruder, Jerry Logan, survives the attack, he will reveal a sordid tale of love, jealousy, and betrayal.

programme.title: Deceived
programme.desc: Abraham Kennard was a fast-talking pastor with an ambitious real estate investment opportunity. Hundreds of pastors and parishioners from churches across the country were lured by Kennards lavish lifestyle and promises of enormous returns. But though the millions poured in, the returns never poured out, revealing this supposed man of Godto be a man of greed.

programme.title: Thou Shalt Not
programme.desc: In Bethesda, Maryland, Brittany Norwoods quick fall from grace lands her in the center of a murder investigation that rattles the community. And later, in Pennsylvania, an irresistible sin creeps up behind a husband and wife meant to be togetheruntil death do they part.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: When Felicia Scotts man demands a child she cant give him, she dives into a homicidal tailspin to get him exactly what he wants. Then, Victoria Jackson commits the ultimate act of betrayal against one of her own family members, at her dangerously jealous mans request.

programme.title: #Murder
programme.desc: 15-year-old Mikarah Sanders and 16-year-old Matthew DuBois were two typical teenagers in a whirlwind romance. The two were inseparable; when they werent together, they were messaging on MySpace. But when a New Years Eve in Seattle ends in the mysterious shooting of Mikarah and Matthew, police scour social media to piece together the crime. Their search for answers would reveal a tale of jealousy, rage, and the murder of an innocent teen.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: Quinn and Velazquez are called when Jerry Heard is found dead from gunshot wounds. They learn Heard spends his nights at a local bar, and the night he was killed, he made passes at two different women, one with an armed boyfriend. With at least three potential suspects, the detectives get to work.

programme.title: Sins of the City

programme.desc: Wealthy, eccentric and obese aristocrat Freddy Butler drops dead, shortly after gathering all three of his wives at Haddington Hall to make an announcement. Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating the extended Butler family, uncovering hidden secrets, illegitimate children and elusive treasure in the process.

programme.title: The Growing Toll of America's Booming Kratom Industry
programme.desc: American use of the Southeast Asian plant kratom has grown dramatically in recent years, spurring both a lucrative industry and national lobbying effort while worrying health experts who fear its addictive effects and point to thousands of related deaths. In this Bloomberg Originals documentary, we reveal how the unregulated substance is being promoted and even made more potent, and how some users are ending up dead.
