programme.desc: Mikeys getting married soon and the clock is ticking to get his teeth picture-perfect. Lynns embarrassed by the color of her teeth and wont wait another moment for a white smile. Can the FIXT team get the work done in time?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A young boy and his family's housekeeper are brutally killed in an upscale Omaha neighborhood. Their case goes cold for years, until another double homicide reveals the link and unmasks a serial killer.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Stitch showcases the feel-good and do-good that make up the fabric of America from inspiring tales of perseverance, to good Samaritans helping neighbors, to trailblazers improving their communities.

programme.title: Easy Money: Fraud, Fortune and Failures
programme.desc: (2021) With nearly 15 hours of interviews from 17 people and dozens of hours of news footage Easy Money tells the story of what is being called the worst fraud in California history.

programme.title: KCRA Local News
programme.desc: Get the latest news and weather from KCRA.

programme.title: News Fallback: Hour Long Docs
programme.desc: Long form storytelling from Very Local.

programme.title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.desc: A stranger than fiction documentary that chronicles a semi-scripted extreme sporting league that premiered in 2000. Socker Slam took elements of wrestling, rugby and butts up shenanigans and body slammed them into a soccer drama.

programme.title: KCRA Local News
programme.desc: Get the latest news and weather from KCRA.

programme.title: Lowrider Legacy
programme.desc: Lowrider Legacy follows celebrated lowrider families, scholars, and activists and documents the history of resistance on wheels that has defined lowrider culture.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join host Rob Mariano, also known as Boston Rob from the Survivor series, as he explores the best of Beantown from classic institutions to new local gems.

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Amanda Machon meets with a different guest each episode who will show off their favorite spots in Albuquerque and the best way to experience this one-of-a-kind city. This series is all about discovering everything that makes ABQ unique and exciting.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Catalina, a 10-year-old community hero with a heart of gold spends her days giving back. Today, Meaghan surprises Catalina with a day of her own, from Sea adventures to a new set of wheels and more. It's her time to shine.

programme.title: News Fallback: Hour Long Docs
programme.desc: Long form storytelling from Very Local.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: In Free Spirit, award-winning bartender and host Kate Gerwin takes to the road and meets people in their workplaces and their favorite watering holes.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Join WNBA player and Olympian Angel McCoughtry as she shows us the people and places that put Baltimore on the map. From sailing the Chesapeake, to sampling street foods, McCoughtry pulls back the curtain on what makes the Charm City so special.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Makers, crafters and artists square off to create the most iconic art piece that best represents their city. From glass-blowers and chalk artists to metalsmiths and tattooers, see who Host Ashley Adams and the judges will crown the victor.

programme.title: Good To Know

programme.title: Animal Athletes
programme.desc: In this episode, we'll examine some of the animal kingdom's fastest sprinters, like the Cheetah. Also, the mysteries of animal intelligence are revealed as we take a look at Dolphins and Orangutans.

programme.title: The Predators
programme.desc: In this episode, we examine some of the world's most fearsome predators. Find out why Owls are the only birds that can fly without making any sound. And how the Leopard uses its amazing night vision to catch its prey.

programme.title: Rumbling Earth
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau examines the cause of volcanoes, earthquakes and tsunamis. We visit the Big Island of Hawaii, where there is still an active volcano. Then we visit a laboratory at Oregon State University that is able to simulate a tsunami. We'll explore the damage that these massive waves cause. Then we head to the Puget Sound in Washington and discover the history of tsunamis in the Northwest with the help of geologist, Brian Atwater. We'll learn if a tsunami will happen again on the west coast.

programme.title: Extinction Earth
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau explores Yellowstone National Park, the site of a potential super-volcano. Fifty miles of magma lurks near the surface, and if it were to erupt, its ash would cover the earth and damage crops worldwide as well as our drinking water. Then Philippe visits Meteor Crater in Arizona, the site where a meteor once struck 50,000 years ago. We'll examine the damage it caused, and wonder if it could happen again. Then we travel to the Hawaiian Island of Maui, where powerful telescopes search the universe for meteors that might be heading our way. We explore the possibility of another meteor reaching our planet.

programme.title: Arctic Animals
programme.desc: In this episode, we'll feature animals that live in the freezing arctic. Learn how the Polar Bear has developed special adaptations that help it survive in the most unforgiving climate imaginable. And why the Wolverine is able to hunt so efficiently in the snow.

programme.title: Man's Best Friend
programme.desc: In this episode, we examine the science behind man's best friend - the dog. Find out what makes a greyhound so fast. See how a bloodhound's nose really works, and the reason that border collies are so intelligent is revealed.

programme.title: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham takes us on a photowalk through Los Angeles

programme.title: Sicily
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham takes us on a photowalk through Sicily

programme.title: Marshall Fire
programme.desc: Scripps News puts the 2021 Marshall Fire into focus. The Colorado wildfire, which destroyed more than 1,000 homes and structures in Boulder County, became the most destructive wildfire in state history. More than two years later, many outside Denver are still rebuilding what they lost.

programme.title: Sikh Temple Shooting
programme.desc: Scripps News revisits the the Sikh Temple in Wisconsin in the community of Oak Creek, a site of a tragic shooting on August 5, 2012, where seven worshipers lost their lives to an act fueled by hate and extremism. More than a decade later, we delve into the community's journey of healing, resilience, and the power of forgiveness.

programme.title: Ukraine's Women Warriors
programme.desc: Reported from inside Ukraine. The call to fight for freedom is being answered by Ukrainian women, showcasing their strength and bravery.

programme.title: Weighing The Costs
programme.desc: Amid a surge in demand for weight loss drugs, concerns about safety are growing. Are these drugs effective? Are they safe?

programme.title: Good To Know
programme.desc: Discover inspirational news, with real-life stories of everyday people who positively impact their communities.

programme.title: Good To Know
programme.desc: Discover inspirational news, with real-life stories of everyday people who positively impact their communities.

programme.title: After The Fall
programme.desc: A journalist, an activist and a refugee give firsthand accounts of life in Afghanistan as the Taliban took over.

programme.title: The God Thieves: The Source
programme.desc: Join Nelufar Hedayat and Scripps News' "In Real Life" for an exploration of the multi-billion-dollar trade in trafficked artifacts.

programme.title: The Craigslist Killer
programme.desc: When three different women who advertised in the Erotic Services section of Craigslist are assaulted, and one of them killed, Boston police match surveillance video and witness reports to a young man that no one would ever suspect to be a killer.

programme.title: Snipers In The Capital
programme.desc: When a deadly sniper terrorizes the DC area for weeks, frantic police put out an APB for a white van. But the FBI has a theory that there might be more than one sniper, and they're not driving a white van.

programme.title: Intern Gone Missing
programme.desc: When government intern Chandra Levy goes missing just hours after she decides to move to a new city, detectives discover she may have been having an affair with a senator the only suspect with a possible motive. A man already in jail claims to know more, but can he be trusted?

programme.title: An Ex Attacks
programme.desc: When a young man is brutally murdered in his home, the only suspect with a motive is his ex-girlfriend, who claims she hasn't seen the victim for months. But detectives uncover a digital camera in the victim's washing machine, DNA evidence, and phone messages that tell a different story.

programme.title: Deaths In The Family
programme.desc: When three members of the same family die of mysterious causes, police begin to suspect they have been poisoned. Detectives exhume bodies and confirm the presence of antifreeze, but who is the poisoner, and why? The secret almost dies when a fourth family member is poisoned, but survives.

programme.title: The Killer Producer
programme.desc: When an aspiring actress is found dead in the home of a legendary music producer, he claims it was suicide. But as detectives piece together the crime scene, study the pattern of blood splatter, and the position of the weapon, they zero in on their suspect and a history of bizarre behavior.

programme.title: Bind, Torture, Kill
programme.desc: A killer terrorizes Wichita, Kansas, preying on random people and families, tying them up, and strangling them. But then the killer goes quiet. When he resurfaces decades later, police find a way to lure him to reveal his identity and it's a man no one suspected.

programme.title: The Ghost Of Baton Rouge
programme.desc: When a series of women are murdered in Baton Rouge, police draw a profile and begin DNA testing a segment of the city's population white men. But when one victim survives, she tells detectives they're on the wrong trail. The killer isn't white.

programme.title: Operation Black Biscuit: Infiltrating The Hells Angels
programme.desc: ATF agent Jay Dobyns infiltrates the notorious Hell's Angels motorcycle club in the midst of a deadly biker war over drug profits and territory. Dobyns must first pass a series of tests to determine if he's worthy of wearing Angels' colors and running with the pack. To collect evidence against the gang, the ATF agent must outsmart the club at its own game. But in doing so, Dobyns places a target on his back and puts his family in harm's way.

programme.title: Operation Cayman: Drug Smuggling On The High Seas
programme.desc: South Florida lawman, Jim Sweeting, partners with the DEA to infiltrate a network of drug dealers moving pot and coke via the Cayman Islands. Sweeting leap-frogs from dealer to dealer, busting them one at a time and moving closer to cutting off the Cayman connection. The operation is a minefield of bureaucratic roadblocks and gun wielding traffickers that Sweeting must juggle, while staying inside the lines of the law. If he makes a mistake and his identity is revealed, it will mean certain death.

programme.title: Operation Mr. Untouchable: Dethroning Harlem's Heroin King
programme.desc: Nicky Barnes is Harlem's Heroin King. After serving time in jail for drug dealing, Barnes has learned ways to make himself untouchable and his drug empire is such big business that even the President of the United States has taken notice. It will take patience and street smarts for DEA agent, Louis Diaz, to unravel the viper's nest of Barnes' associates and bring them all to justice - and for Diaz himself to stay alive.

programme.title: Operation Greylord: Undercover In The Halls Of Injustice
programme.desc: State prosecutor Terry Hake fulfills a lifelong dream by going undercover for the FBI in Chicago. Hake works tirelessly to expose rampant corruption in the Cook County court system. Wearing a wire, he befriends and bribes crooked judges, lawyers, and bailiffs who participate in a pay-to-play perversion of justice. All told, his work results in the indictments of 92 public officials in what many call the largest government corruption case in history.

More than two years later, many outside Denver are still rebuilding what they lost.

programme.title: Sikh Temple Shooting
programme.desc: Scripps News revisits the the Sikh Temple in Wisconsin in the community of Oak Creek, a site of a tragic shooting on August 5, 2012, where seven worshipers lost their lives to an act fueled by hate and extremism. More than a decade later, we delve into the community's journey of healing, resilience, and the power of forgiveness.

programme.title: Scripps News On The Scene

programme.title: Happening Now In America
programme.desc: Follow what's happening across America with up-to-the minute details on the major events driving the day's top stories.

programme.title: Today As It Happened
programme.desc: What happened today? Find out as Scripps News gets you up to speed on the day's events that everyone is talking about.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: Mikeys getting married soon and the clock is ticking to get his teeth picture-perfect. Lynns embarrassed by the color of her teeth and wont wait another moment for a white smile. Can the FIXT team get the work done in time?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In a serene community, a beloved doctor is bludgeoned in her own home. Investigators uncover a conspiracy that rocks the close-knit neighborhood to its core.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot: Marvel Actor, TikTok Fitness Mom, & Top Comedian Find Thrills at Theme Park
programme.desc: Our local experts know the best thrills at Fun Spot. Orlandos top comedian braves the gravity-defying SkyCoaster, a monster DJ and actor cant stop screaming on White Lightning, and an influencer leaves all her followers behind on the go-kart track.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Weeks after a pregnant woman is shot and killed in Orlando, a shootout between her suspected killer and a police officer sparks a manhunt.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Follow Maddy & Dixie as they go on a historical tour around iconic Sacramento locales. Learn how the city was raised during floods. And check out the famous banana cream pie at Frank Fats.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Darlene, a young superfan with cerebral palsy, becomes Justin's date for one magical night after the team hears her story and learns how much she loves the show.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Growing up, two siblings hear unsettling stories about their family's history. They don't know what to believe about the ones who went missing in 1992, until, decades later, the haunting truth comes out.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In 1990, an 18-year-old driving across Wisconsin to a job conference never arrives. After her van and later her body are discovered, the mystery surrounding Berit Becks death persists for more than two decades. What happened in that van?

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Chefs Jessica Peconi and Dee Dixon are getting saucy in todays cooking challenge. Can the chefs craft the most savory dips, dressings, or relish? Or will they get Lost in the Sauce?

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Skip your workout, because this episode will have you sweating. Chef Wong Jangkeun and Chef Allyson Harvie turn up the heat on this three course spice-centric challenge. Who will best bring on the burn?

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Rob feasts on fabulous cuisine, makes more than a few new friends and joins a trampoline gym class in one of Boston's oldest neighborhoods.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: The mother-daughter dynamic duo of Cher and Sabria Delaine are best friends and do almost everything together except get out into nature. So Kinga meets up with ladies to mix things up and try to blend Chers island life with some southern comfort.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From a car crashing into a home to a lemur fleeing a DUI scene, these captivating real-life stories explore intense arrests caught on film.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Master bartender Kate Gerwin visits Kansas City to talk whiskey, taste the nonalcoholic future at an innovative new bar, experience jazz at the Mutual Musicians Foundation, and learn all about Prohibition in the city that ignored it best.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: This is the formal food frenzy you don't want to miss. Chefs Tyler Johnson and Ben Lefenfeld are getting bougie for this Black Tie Dinner challenge. Whose meal will win best dressed?

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Miranda, a 24-year-old mechanical engineer was diagnosed with MS. Determined not to let MS dim her zest for life, Miranda and Kinga set out to find the outdoor fun in and around Cincinnati.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Discover where classic dishes collide to create delightful flavors. From pizza debates to the Juicy Lucy to a good old-fashioned red beer, see how regional creativity transforms beloved foods into something more.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Catch the perfect sunset after learning to sail or riding the rails. Devour a cheeseboard al fresco, sip on a cool drink poolside, or slide into a booth at a classic Italian restaurant. This is Newport.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Maddy & Dixie invite you along for a fabulous day of decadence and pampering at some of their favorite treat yo-self spots in Sactown.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Brendan wields the baton leading the orchestra, achieves his dream of performing with a cast of Queens, and serves up das boot with German local legends.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Stitch showcases the feel-good and do-good that make up the fabric of America from inspiring tales of perseverance, to good Samaritans helping neighbors, to trailblazers improving their communities.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Host and comedic actor Amy Brassette McKeon challenges two sets of couples to pass a good time on a dime in their city. Find out which couple will experience the most amazing date for under fifty bucks.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: In this game show, comedian Frank Nicotero hits the streets to ask people questions inspired by the wildest news stories for a chance at winning a cash prize. These real-life stories with unreal outcomes will make you say, Wait, What Happened?"

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Rickwood
programme.desc: This is the story of the oldest professional ballpark in the U.S. and the determination of its home team, the Black Barons. The voice of Rickwood tells the tale of its pivotal role in The Negro League, Black history and its legacy in American sports.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the citys unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join host Rob Mariano, also known as Boston Rob from the Survivor series, as he explores the best of Beantown from classic institutions to new local gems.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: News Fallback: Hour Long Docs
programme.desc: Long form storytelling from Very Local.

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminals and a casino magnates family forever.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Witness extreme car chases captured on video, from fleeing via fire truck to off-roading into a corn field. Fortunately no one is seriously hurt except, at times, the vehicles.

programme.title: In Transit by Esquire
programme.desc: Host Dave Holmes meets celebrity guests at the airport bar to discuss must-do activities in cities across America. So when youre ready to board your next flight, youll have an Esquire-approved itinerary.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Each episode of this documentary series features incredible sports stories from iconic American cities. From gritty underdog victories to passionate unlikely match-ups, the series proves that sports are so much more than a pastime.

programme.title: Underdog Uprising
programme.desc: Every game day, fans pour into the stands to cheer on New Mexico's soccer team. But these are no ordinary supporters. From the Curse, to Sektor 114, to the Black Diamonds these fans are making New Mexico United.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Maddy & Dixie are social media influencers who have nothing but love for Sacramento. Join them as they explore the heart and soul of the city through incredible activities, hidden gems, amazing eats and the locals who make Sactown so special.

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This week Matter of Fact returns to Lebanon, KS to see how life has changed for the small farming community. Plus, the executive director of When We All Vote on the importance of showing up for every election. And, an 84-year-old Holocaust survivor can vote for the first time in his life.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: Maker Nation

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: One local single experiences some of the best their city has to offer on three blind dates. Our singles may spend three perfect days out on the town, but there can only be one love match. Who will be picked for a second date?

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Uncover the Midwest's unexpected. From quirky to inventive flavor mash-ups like the bulgogi burger to the questionable sour cream & raisin pie, see how the area crafts some interesting but delightful culinary concoctions.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Karla, a devoted mother and doting grandmother has had her fair share of obstacles from two bouts of cancer to caring for her husband and daughter. Karla embarks on a much needed day of pampering, seeking solace and self-care.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay

programme.title: Animal Athletes
programme.desc: In this episode, we'll examine some of the animal kingdom's fastest sprinters, like the Cheetah. Also, the mysteries of animal intelligence are revealed as we take a look at Dolphins and Orangutans.

programme.title: The Predators
programme.desc: In this episode, we examine some of the world's most fearsome predators. Find out why Owls are the only birds that can fly without making any sound. And how the Leopard uses its amazing night vision to catch its prey.

programme.title: Rumbling Earth
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau examines the cause of volcanoes, earthquakes and tsunamis. We visit the Big Island of Hawaii, where there is still an active volcano. Then we visit a laboratory at Oregon State University that is able to simulate a tsunami. We'll explore the damage that these massive waves cause. Then we head to the Puget Sound in Washington and discover the history of tsunamis in the Northwest with the help of geologist, Brian Atwater. We'll learn if a tsunami will happen again on the west coast.

programme.title: Extinction Earth
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau explores Yellowstone National Park, the site of a potential super-volcano. Fifty miles of magma lurks near the surface, and if it were to erupt, its ash would cover the earth and damage crops worldwide as well as our drinking water. Then Philippe visits Meteor Crater in Arizona, the site where a meteor once struck 50,000 years ago. We'll examine the damage it caused, and wonder if it could happen again. Then we travel to the Hawaiian Island of Maui, where powerful telescopes search the universe for meteors that might be heading our way. We explore the possibility of another meteor reaching our planet.

programme.title: Arctic Animals
programme.desc: In this episode, we'll feature animals that live in the freezing arctic. Learn how the Polar Bear has developed special adaptations that help it survive in the most unforgiving climate imaginable. And why the Wolverine is able to hunt so efficiently in the snow.

programme.title: Man's Best Friend
programme.desc: In this episode, we examine the science behind man's best friend - the dog. Find out what makes a greyhound so fast. See how a bloodhound's nose really works, and the reason that border collies are so intelligent is revealed.

programme.title: After The Fall
programme.desc: A journalist, an activist and a refugee give firsthand accounts of life in Afghanistan as the Taliban took over.

programme.title: The God Thieves: The Source
programme.desc: Join Nelufar Hedayat and Scripps News' "In Real Life" for an exploration of the multi-billion-dollar trade in trafficked artifacts.

programme.title: The Craigslist Killer
programme.desc: When three different women who advertised in the Erotic Services section of Craigslist are assaulted, and one of them killed, Boston police match surveillance video and witness reports to a young man that no one would ever suspect to be a killer.

programme.title: Snipers In The Capital
programme.desc: When a deadly sniper terrorizes the DC area for weeks, frantic police put out an APB for a white van. But the FBI has a theory that there might be more than one sniper, and they're not driving a white van.

programme.title: Intern Gone Missing
programme.desc: When government intern Chandra Levy goes missing just hours after she decides to move to a new city, detectives discover she may have been having an affair with a senator the only suspect with a possible motive. A man already in jail claims to know more, but can he be trusted?

programme.title: An Ex Attacks
programme.desc: When a young man is brutally murdered in his home, the only suspect with a motive is his ex-girlfriend, who claims she hasn't seen the victim for months. But detectives uncover a digital camera in the victim's washing machine, DNA evidence, and phone messages that tell a different story.

programme.title: Deaths In The Family
programme.desc: When three members of the same family die of mysterious causes, police begin to suspect they have been poisoned. Detectives exhume bodies and confirm the presence of antifreeze, but who is the poisoner, and why? The secret almost dies when a fourth family member is poisoned, but survives.

programme.title: The Killer Producer
programme.desc: When an aspiring actress is found dead in the home of a legendary music producer, he claims it was suicide. But as detectives piece together the crime scene, study the pattern of blood splatter, and the position of the weapon, they zero in on their suspect and a history of bizarre behavior.

programme.title: Bind, Torture, Kill
programme.desc: A killer terrorizes Wichita, Kansas, preying on random people and families, tying them up, and strangling them. But then the killer goes quiet. When he resurfaces decades later, police find a way to lure him to reveal his identity and it's a man no one suspected.

programme.title: KATC 5:30 pm News
programme.desc: KATC News in Acadiana - The latest local and national news and local weather, traffic and sports.

programme.title: Replay: KATC 5:30 pm
programme.desc: KATC News in Acadiana - The latest local and national news and local weather, traffic and sports.

programme.title: Operation Cayman: Drug Smuggling On The High Seas
programme.desc: South Florida lawman, Jim Sweeting, partners with the DEA to infiltrate a network of drug dealers moving pot and coke via the Cayman Islands. Sweeting leap-frogs from dealer to dealer, busting them one at a time and moving closer to cutting off the Cayman connection. The operation is a minefield of bureaucratic roadblocks and gun wielding traffickers that Sweeting must juggle, while staying inside the lines of the law. If he makes a mistake and his identity is revealed, it will mean certain death.

programme.title: Operation Mr. Untouchable: Dethroning Harlem's Heroin King
programme.desc: Nicky Barnes is Harlem's Heroin King. After serving time in jail for drug dealing, Barnes has learned ways to make himself untouchable and his drug empire is such big business that even the President of the United States has taken notice. It will take patience and street smarts for DEA agent, Louis Diaz, to unravel the viper's nest of Barnes' associates and bring them all to justice - and for Diaz himself to stay alive.

programme.title: Operation Greylord: Undercover In The Halls Of Injustice
programme.desc: State prosecutor Terry Hake fulfills a lifelong dream by going undercover for the FBI in Chicago. Hake works tirelessly to expose rampant corruption in the Cook County court system. Wearing a wire, he befriends and bribes crooked judges, lawyers, and bailiffs who participate in a pay-to-play perversion of justice. All told, his work results in the indictments of 92 public officials in what many call the largest government corruption case in history.

programme.title: The God Thieves: Black Market
programme.desc: Continuing a global journey, Scripps News explores the shadowy black market for looted and fake valuables.

programme.title: Living With Wolves
programme.desc: Wolves are returning to the American West a century after they were nearly eradicated. But can they co-exist on a landscape now reshaped by humans?

programme.title: Scripps News Showcase: One More Orbit
programme.desc: A daring team of astronauts and aviators flies a high-speed Gulfstream jet around the planet, setting the pole-to-pole circumnavigation record.

programme.title: Extinction Earth
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau explores Yellowstone National Park, the site of a potential super-volcano. Fifty miles of magma lurks near the surface, and if it were to erupt, its ash would cover the earth and damage crops worldwide as well as our drinking water. Then Philippe visits Meteor Crater in Arizona, the site where a meteor once struck 50,000 years ago. We'll examine the damage it caused, and wonder if it could happen again. Then we travel to the Hawaiian Island of Maui, where powerful telescopes search the universe for meteors that might be heading our way. We explore the possibility of another meteor reaching our planet.

programme.title: Arctic Animals
programme.desc: In this episode, we'll feature animals that live in the freezing arctic. Learn how the Polar Bear has developed special adaptations that help it survive in the most unforgiving climate imaginable. And why the Wolverine is able to hunt so efficiently in the snow.

programme.title: Man's Best Friend
programme.desc: In this episode, we examine the science behind man's best friend - the dog. Find out what makes a greyhound so fast. See how a bloodhound's nose really works, and the reason that border collies are so intelligent is revealed.

programme.title: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham takes us on a photowalk through Los Angeles

programme.title: Sicily
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham takes us on a photowalk through Sicily

programme.title: Marshall Fire
programme.desc: Scripps News puts the 2021 Marshall Fire into focus. The Colorado wildfire, which destroyed more than 1,000 homes and structures in Boulder County, became the most destructive wildfire in state history. More than two years later, many outside Denver are still rebuilding what they lost.

programme.title: Sikh Temple Shooting
programme.desc: Scripps News revisits the the Sikh Temple in Wisconsin in the community of Oak Creek, a site of a tragic shooting on August 5, 2012, where seven worshipers lost their lives to an act fueled by hate and extremism. More than a decade later, we delve into the community's journey of healing, resilience, and the power of forgiveness.

programme.title: Ukraine's Women Warriors
programme.desc: Reported from inside Ukraine. The call to fight for freedom is being answered by Ukrainian women, showcasing their strength and bravery.

programme.title: Weighing The Costs
programme.desc: Amid a surge in demand for weight loss drugs, concerns about safety are growing. Are these drugs effective? Are they safe?

programme.title: Good To Know
programme.desc: Discover inspirational news, with real-life stories of everyday people who positively impact their communities.

programme.title: Good To Know
programme.desc: Discover inspirational news, with real-life stories of everyday people who positively impact their communities.

programme.title: After The Fall
programme.desc: A journalist, an activist and a refugee give firsthand accounts of life in Afghanistan as the Taliban took over.

programme.title: The God Thieves: The Source
programme.desc: Join Nelufar Hedayat and Scripps News' "In Real Life" for an exploration of the multi-billion-dollar trade in trafficked artifacts.

programme.title: The Craigslist Killer
programme.desc: When three different women who advertised in the Erotic Services section of Craigslist are assaulted, and one of them killed, Boston police match surveillance video and witness reports to a young man that no one would ever suspect to be a killer.

programme.title: Snipers In The Capital
programme.desc: When a deadly sniper terrorizes the DC area for weeks, frantic police put out an APB for a white van. But the FBI has a theory that there might be more than one sniper, and they're not driving a white van.

programme.title: Intern Gone Missing
programme.desc: When government intern Chandra Levy goes missing just hours after she decides to move to a new city, detectives discover she may have been having an affair with a senator the only suspect with a possible motive. A man already in jail claims to know more, but can he be trusted?

programme.title: An Ex Attacks
programme.desc: When a young man is brutally murdered in his home, the only suspect with a motive is his ex-girlfriend, who claims she hasn't seen the victim for months. But detectives uncover a digital camera in the victim's washing machine, DNA evidence, and phone messages that tell a different story.

programme.title: Deaths In The Family
programme.desc: When three members of the same family die of mysterious causes, police begin to suspect they have been poisoned. Detectives exhume bodies and confirm the presence of antifreeze, but who is the poisoner, and why? The secret almost dies when a fourth family member is poisoned, but survives.

programme.title: The Killer Producer
programme.desc: When an aspiring actress is found dead in the home of a legendary music producer, he claims it was suicide. But as detectives piece together the crime scene, study the pattern of blood splatter, and the position of the weapon, they zero in on their suspect and a history of bizarre behavior.

programme.title: Bind, Torture, Kill
programme.desc: A killer terrorizes Wichita, Kansas, preying on random people and families, tying them up, and strangling them. But then the killer goes quiet. When he resurfaces decades later, police find a way to lure him to reveal his identity and it's a man no one suspected.

programme.title: The Ghost Of Baton Rouge
programme.desc: When a series of women are murdered in Baton Rouge, police draw a profile and begin DNA testing a segment of the city's population white men. But when one victim survives, she tells detectives they're on the wrong trail. The killer isn't white.

programme.title: Operation Black Biscuit: Infiltrating The Hells Angels
programme.desc: ATF agent Jay Dobyns infiltrates the notorious Hell's Angels motorcycle club in the midst of a deadly biker war over drug profits and territory. Dobyns must first pass a series of tests to determine if he's worthy of wearing Angels' colors and running with the pack. To collect evidence against the gang, the ATF agent must outsmart the club at its own game. But in doing so, Dobyns places a target on his back and puts his family in harm's way.

programme.title: Operation Greylord: Undercover In The Halls Of Injustice
programme.desc: State prosecutor Terry Hake fulfills a lifelong dream by going undercover for the FBI in Chicago. Hake works tirelessly to expose rampant corruption in the Cook County court system. Wearing a wire, he befriends and bribes crooked judges, lawyers, and bailiffs who participate in a pay-to-play perversion of justice. All told, his work results in the indictments of 92 public officials in what many call the largest government corruption case in history.

programme.title: The God Thieves: Black Market
programme.desc: Continuing a global journey, Scripps News explores the shadowy black market for looted and fake valuables.

programme.title: Living With Wolves
programme.desc: Wolves are returning to the American West a century after they were nearly eradicated. But can they co-exist on a landscape now reshaped by humans?

programme.title: Scripps News Showcase: One More Orbit
programme.desc: A daring team of astronauts and aviators flies a high-speed Gulfstream jet around the planet, setting the pole-to-pole circumnavigation record.
